commit_message:
Fix l3-agent crash on routers without ha_state

l3-agent checks the HA state of routers when a router is updated.
To ensure that the HA state is only checked on HA routers the following
check is performed: `if router.get('ha') and not is_dvr_only_agent`.
This check should ensure that the check is only performed on
DvrEdgeHaRouter and HaRouter objects.

Unfortunately, there are cases where we have DvrEdgeRouter objects
running on 'dvr_snat' agents. E.g. when deploying a loadbalancer with
neutron-lbaas in a landscape with 6 network nodes and
max_l3_agents_per_router set to 3, it may happen that the loadbalancer
is placed on a network node that does not have a DvrEdgeHaRouter running
on it. In such a case, neutron will deploy a DvrEdgeRouter object on the
network node to serve the loadbalancer, just like it would deploy a
DvrEdgeRouter on a compute node when deploying a VM.

Under such circumstances each update to the router will lead to an
AttributeError, because the DvrEdgeRouter object does not have the
ha_state attribute.

This patch circumvents the issue by doing an additional check on the
router object to ensure that it actually has the ha_state attribute.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Change-Id: I755990324db445efd0ee0b8a9db1f4d7bfb58e26
Closes-Bug: #1755243
(cherry picked from commit 8c2dae659a806fdc20331de4b8a917ec3ae0e6f6)

commit_message:
DVR: FloatingIP create throws an error if no l3 agent

FloatingIP create throws an error if the L3 agent is not running
on the given host for DVR Routers.
This happens when we try to create a DVR Router in the Legacy
Router deployed cloud.
FloatingIP create checks for the agent type based on the host,
and when agents are not available on the given host, it raises
an exception.
This patch will fixes by handling the exception raised, when the
agent is not available.

Change-Id: I80522d12087495861e832cf1c7a3fe9a7830d386
Closes-Bug: #1776566
(cherry picked from commit 5ceca4d9d1041345ccfeab675c8e8216050f7135)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 14:47:22.000000000', 'message': '[Fullstack] Wait for SG to be applied by L2 agent

In fullstack test_securitygroup there were used simple
net_helpers.assert_ping() and assert_not_ping() functions
which tries to ping IP address 3 times with some short timeout
and test fails if result of ping will not be as expected.

Unfortunately sometimes in fullstack tests it might be not enough
if test is creating new SG or SG rule or apply SG to port and
just after that checks connection because L2 agent don't have
enough time to apply all rules on "host".
This patch changes it to use block_until_ping() and
block_until_no_ping() methods from FakeMachine fixture.
It will also check if ping is possible/not possible but
will try to check it for 1 minute before fails.

Similar change is also done for methods which checks TCP
connectivity using netcat helper class. It now uses
common_utils.wait_until_true() helper function instead of
fail immediatelly.

Change-Id: I9e523d803e3c49d5d090ae5b9d36d43ce7311535
Closes-Bug: #1774006
Closes-Bug: #1767829
(cherry picked from commit 11b41d73b48d46b7725bb97d4b85158d8bc2acfb)
'}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Wait for SG to be applied by L2 agent

In fullstack test_securitygroup there were used simple
net_helpers.assert_ping() and assert_not_ping() functions
which tries to ping IP address 3 times with some short timeout
and test fails if result of ping will not be as expected.

Unfortunately sometimes in fullstack tests it might be not enough
if test is creating new SG or SG rule or apply SG to port and
just after that checks connection because L2 agent don't have
enough time to apply all rules on "host".
This patch changes it to use block_until_ping() and
block_until_no_ping() methods from FakeMachine fixture.
It will also check if ping is possible/not possible but
will try to check it for 1 minute before fails.

Similar change is also done for methods which checks TCP
connectivity using netcat helper class. It now uses
common_utils.wait_until_true() helper function instead of
fail immediatelly.

Change-Id: I9e523d803e3c49d5d090ae5b9d36d43ce7311535
Closes-Bug: #1774006
Closes-Bug: #1767829
(cherry picked from commit 11b41d73b48d46b7725bb97d4b85158d8bc2acfb)

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: Ia87f89e0c6d01400548623d9b67641e72673309c
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit 9e31a4071d77b18489952edf1de0a5c4c64c5d64)

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained project
to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ibb1e23aceeb9a864306c52b410bda77736454ef0
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-28 00:11:10.000000000', 'message': 'include all versions of Node in release_mappings

For a particular ironic release, we need to include all the
possible versions of a particular object. Node (so far) has
two versions: 1.24 and 1.25 in this current release.

(Without the two versions, there could be issues upgrading
ironic from an older-master release with Node version 1.24,
to a newer-master release with Node version 1.25.)

Change-Id: I27c8d12add23ad72ea2debd1aec2bf6afaff2f90
'}]
commit_message:
include all versions of Node in release_mappings

For a particular ironic release, we need to include all the
possible versions of a particular object. Node (so far) has
two versions: 1.24 and 1.25 in this current release.

(Without the two versions, there could be issues upgrading
ironic from an older-master release with Node version 1.24,
to a newer-master release with Node version 1.25.)

Change-Id: I27c8d12add23ad72ea2debd1aec2bf6afaff2f90

commit_message:

[{'created': '2018-06-12 14:17:55.000000000', 'message': "Enable relative paths for tripleo deploy roles data

The current behavior only allows absolute or relative to --templates
paths, but arguably the more common case is running the CLI from e.g

Change-Id: Ide6f7f4a2b6104ece813f2e5f99c12cff5017ce1

commit_message:
Enable relative paths for tripleo deploy roles data

The current behavior only allows absolute or relative to --templates
paths, but arguably the more common case is running the CLI from e.g
/home/stack with -r myroles.yaml, which currently doesn't work.

Change-Id: Ide6f7f4a2b6104ece813f2e5f99c12cff5017ce1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-07 15:19:27.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Move keystone start scripts into ansible

This is a proof of concept / work in progress to demonstrate how we can
move the start scripts from the images into kolla-ansible as proposed
at the Rocky PTG.

I will write a spec to detail the thinking behind this, but in short:

When Kolla was created, we knew a lot less about the best way to run
services in containers compared to what we know now. There were many
efforts to make truly idempotent containers, where everything from
config to start scripts were baked in, and nothing could change without
upgrading the container. In practice, baking the start scripts into the
containers has essentially coupled the containers to kolla-ansible,
meaning kolla-ansible must be used with kolla containers, and vice
versa.

Managing config and start logic externally now seems to be becoming more
common place, making containers essentially lightweight packages for
processes, leaving the orchestration and config of those processes to
tools that specialise in this, e.g. ansible, k8s, etc. This patch will
result in no visible or difference to the end user, but opens up a lot
of opportunities for kolla, such as moving to official service images,
loci images for openstack, etc.

Change-Id: I695eec8a2d799c60d1c1d24417ae1e72f402127a
'}, {'created': '2018-03-07 15:33:12.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Move keystone start scripts into ansible

Managing config and start logic externally now seems to be becoming more

Change-Id: I695eec8a2d799c60d1c1d24417ae1e72f402127a

meaning kolla-ansible must be used with kolla containers, and vice
versa.

Managing config and start logic externally now seems to be becoming more
common place, making containers essentially lightweight packages for
processes, leaving the orchestration and config of those processes to
tools that specialise in this, e.g. ansible, k8s, etc. This patch will

commit_message:
Move keystone start scripts into ansible

Partially implements: blueprint externalise-scripts
Change-Id: I695eec8a2d799c60d1c1d24417ae1e72f402127a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 05:02:15.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: lxc_apparmor: Temporary disable lxc-start profile on openSUSE

On openSUSE Leap 15, the profile for the lxc-start binary is blocking
containers from starting up with the following error:

type=1400 audit(1530072884.560:125): apparmor="DENIED" operation="mount"
info="failed flags match" error=-13 profile="/usr/bin/lxc-start"
name="/usr/lib64/lxc/rootfs/" pid=30575 comm="lxc-start"
srcname="/var/lib/lxc/container1/rootfs/" flags="rw, rbind"

Investigation has started in the openSUSE bugzilla[1] but until we
figure out what's wrong and a fix lands in the repos, the only way
to move forward is to disable the profile. This must be reverted as
soon as we have a fix in order to restore security around the
containers.

[1] https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1099239
Change-Id: I615c973e459a8beb530c586e1a880ada6e031f75
'}, {'created': '2018-06-27 05:34:42.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: lxc_apparmor: Temporary disable lxc-start profile on openSUSE

containers from starting up with the following error:

type=1400 audit(1530072884.560:125): apparmor="DENIED" operation="mount"

soon as we have a fix in order to restore security around the
containers.

commit_message:
tasks: lxc_apparmor: Temporary disable lxc-start profile on openSUSE

On openSUSE Leap 15, the profile for the lxc-start binary is blocking
containers from starting up with the following error:

type=1400 audit(1530072884.560:125): apparmor="DENIED" operation="mount"
info="failed flags match" error=-13 profile="/usr/bin/lxc-start"
name="/usr/lib64/lxc/rootfs/" pid=30575 comm="lxc-start"
srcname="/var/lib/lxc/container1/rootfs/" flags="rw, rbind"

Investigation has started in the openSUSE bugzilla[1] but until we
figure out what's wrong and a fix lands in the repos, the only way
to move forward is to disable the profile. This must be reverted as
soon as we have a fix in order to restore security around the
containers.

[1] https://bugzilla.opensuse.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1099239
Change-Id: I615c973e459a8beb530c586e1a880ada6e031f75

commit_message:
Workflow and action for deployment failures

Adds a new workflow and corresponding custom action for querying the
ansible failures that occurred during a plan deployment with
config-download.

Relies on the json-error.py ansible callback plugin to provide a
structured data format for the errors.

Change-Id: I16d2dd0b3022cd5964919d07dd0ec603490a3ed7

commit_message:
ovn: Add dns_servers configuration support

networking-ovn optionally expects list of dns server to be defined in the
config -'ovn/dns_servers'. These will be included in the 'dns_server' DHCP
option field when the VMs send DHCP request if the subnet's dns_nameservers field
is not defined by the user.

This patch sets the hieradata - 'neutron::plugins::ml2::ovn::dns_servers' to the
defined OVNDnsServers t-h-t param.

Change-Id: I80574f7badfcc618254266051c8d6661c08e2be0
Closes-bug: #1774052
(cherry picked from 371e5d626491a042afcd5d83377737ae941beb67)
Conflicts:
       environments/services/neutron-ovn-hw-offload.yaml

commit_message:
CI overrides the tripleoclient config code

CI statically overrides a bunch of settings that it should
read from undercloud.conf to test the code there that
generated the environment for undercloud install.

Remove these overrides.

Related-bug: #1777401
Change-Id: I947b4e50dccfa1e9751038d0ccd9737123431e89

commit_message:
Fix debian-security mirror acccess error

Security.debian.org accessing will actually access CDN mirror.
Some mirror should use "security.debian.org/debian-security"
like "mirror.xtom.com.hk", or it will cause apt-get update error[1].

[1]
E: Failed to fetch http://security.debian.org/dists/stretch/updates/main/binary-arm64/Packages 404  Not Found
E: Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.

Change-Id: Idd8b80c5f3c1e4aebd752e1ca6fb643e25eb1837

commit_message:
switch to cryptography

Fernet could not be used as it is not a streaming cipher.
CFB mode does not require padding, so removed padding code.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/c/575199/
Change-Id: I14f58d9d473c20ce7863baa0b2adadbfda268b7a

> This does not look bad!
 > Not sure if we discussed about this, but tls-proxy: false is
 > specific for sahara (we have some issues that should be
 > investigated), but maybe you can try to keep it enabled.

Heh, yeah! I know it! I'm keeping that for an unrelated reason due to how we do generate the certs and the CA for that on our side. Once this is merged I'll just generate a follow-up patch to turn that on ;)

Thanks for the help tosky!"}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-04-12 05:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 09:25:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the experimental multinode jobs

Some changes related to the way multinode works (merged after the PTG
and recently) have been fixing the way it was handled just until now.

Before, multinode would just setup networking in two identical
devstacks. Now proper multinode can be set using group-vars. This commit
adds the needed changes to the kuryr multinode gates so they can be
properly used now.

Change-Id: I8b955e5dc8eb3c86f69e77849348c08d0d0e1a69

commit_message:
Fix the experimental multinode jobs

Some changes related to the way multinode works (merged after the PTG
and recently) have been fixing the way it was handled just until now.

Before, multinode would just setup networking in two identical
devstacks. Now proper multinode can be set using group-vars. This commit
adds the needed changes to the kuryr multinode gates so they can be
properly used now.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578304/
Change-Id: I8b955e5dc8eb3c86f69e77849348c08d0d0e1a69

[{'created': '2018-06-27 12:34:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for j2-rendered user defined drop-ins

Allow users to provide unique/versioned drop-in environment files
rendered from t-h-t-root/drop-ins/*.j2.yaml files with the given
uuid added to the original file names and also used as a jinja tag.
The j2 tags are interpolated by usual meanings, when templates are
processed with the tools/process-templates.py script.

The special case is adding a drop-in to override some heat params
only for the given uinque deployment/heat stack identifier.

Related-bug: #1778505

Change-Id: Id90d9a8d52f35f17a7bbdbbcabf7827b72b06730
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for j2-rendered user defined drop-ins

Allow users to provide unique/versioned drop-in environment files
rendered from t-h-t-root/drop-ins/*.j2.yaml files with the given
uuid added to the original file names and also used as a jinja tag.
The j2 tags are interpolated by usual meanings, when templates are
processed with the tools/process-templates.py script.

The special case is adding a drop-in to override some heat params
only for the given uinque deployment/heat stack identifier.

Related-bug: #1778505

Change-Id: Id90d9a8d52f35f17a7bbdbbcabf7827b72b06730
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Added missing information regarding containerized undercloud and ironic

The doc is lacking the reference to the "--http-boot" option while
importing images into the undercloud Glance service.

This commit adds this information, and is based on the following
merge:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547067/

Change-Id: I01fa62414b1ddf498026e9a2ae3967b24caa45ba
Related-Bug: 1669186

I have queens failing on privsep, so may be it's really necessary"}, {'account_id': 8873, 'date': '2018-06-26 12:20:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

How come we don't have coverage for this in functional tests?"}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-06-26 14:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Slawek, as far as you told me, in Queens we didn't use privsep at
 > all for l3/dhcp/metadata, right?
 > 
 > If we didn't we can abandon this patch

We are using privsep for create/list/delete namespaces, for get routing table and for add/delete neighbor entries. See https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/stable/queens/neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py

commit_message:
Configure privsep helper in neutron-netns-cleanup

This closes a bug that makes netns-cleanup crash when
trying to invoke privsep helper, because the rootwrap
config isn't correctly passed down to the privsep helper
library.

Closes-Bug: #1776468

Change-Id: I8258a44a9e2542ec222ebac72c4b889858ab2fc2
(cherry picked from commit 5106dfe5217b5274305ab565e23dbd1548c1f756)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-15 23:53:38.000000000', 'message': "Use production like interfaces in the gate

The gate presently sets up a psuedo networking environment using a
collection of bridges without any interfaces within them. This change
implements the production example interface file using dummy
interfaces. With this change we'll have the ability to test a production
networking stack with bonded interfaces, VLAN tags, and
bridges. To ensure we're enabling this setup in a uniform way the
systemd-networkd role is used to creat everything needed.

Change-Id: I7fb15ce81056cf7ad5139333d59787e610bd9c75
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use production like interfaces in the gate

The gate presently sets up a pseudo networking environment using a
collection of bridges without any interfaces within them. This change
implements the production example interface file using dummy
interfaces. With this change we'll have the ability to test a production
networking stack with bonded interfaces, VLAN tags, and
bridges. To ensure we're enabling this setup in a uniform way the
systemd-networkd role is used to create everything needed.

> Terminal output from what will be created with this change
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/702382/

Change-Id: I7fb15ce81056cf7ad5139333d59787e610bd9c75
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (ironic)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I9ccf73c5797fd5625d8df3c67420cb6724bbe2e2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571759

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (sahara)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I2556013f462e5c4bff24beb1b11006e524bab5a2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571794

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to transition plan [1],
we should have py36 testenv ready for it.

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition

Change-Id: I70c34207a37b7e4c3d917d6cbb6667c47495e860

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 13:41:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit test modifying global state

The ConductorTaskTestCase.test_build_instances test case uses the
RequestSpec class instead of an instance of the RequestSpec as a mock
return value. If this return value is modified during the test that
modification is done on the class and therefore it is visible to any
subsequent test cases running in the same executor. This could lead to
very strange unit test failures.

This patch adds the missing instantiation to the test case.

Change-Id: Iec47a2c12f35bf050852fe728417c9ddff329a44
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unit test modifying global state

The ConductorTaskTestCase.test_build_instances test case uses the
RequestSpec class instead of an instance of the RequestSpec as a mock
return value. If this return value is modified during the test that
modification is done on the class and therefore it is visible to any
subsequent test cases running in the same executor. This could lead to
very strange unit test failures.

This patch adds the missing instantiation to the test case.

Change-Id: Iec47a2c12f35bf050852fe728417c9ddff329a44

commit_message:
Add option to specify Cgroup driver for Kubelet

This patch allows specification of Cgroup driver for Kubelet service.
The necessity of this patch was realised after upgrading Docker to the
new community edition (17.3+) which defaults to  `cgroupfs` Cgroup
driver but on the other hand, Fedora Atomic (version 27) comes with
1.13. Cgroup drivers for Docker need to be identical for the two
services, Docker and Kubelet, need to be able to work together.

Story: 2002533
Task: 22079
Change-Id: Ia4b38a63ede59e18c8edb01e93acbb66f1e0b0e4

commit_message:
Add support of netapp configuration for glance

This change adds all the required netapp configuration for
glance.

This could also go to puppet-glance eventually, but we need
this backported to Newton. 
I don't think puppet-glance would allow backporting this to Newton, 
because from their point of view it would be a RFE.


Change-Id: I95f4de3ebf3ac7cf9bef8b300ce7e85e38e28a59
Closes-Bug: #1740456

commit_message:
Remove workaround that breaks Intel(R) Xeon(R) Gold 5120 CPU @ 2.20GHz

The bug referenced in the workaround has been closed as resolved
and those settings hang up the undercloud on the Xeon Gold 5120.

After removing the workaround everything goes fine again.

Change-Id: Ie37826c5ad2cd864429d1e33eb43c4b03dedc3b5

commit_message:
Allow multimaster lb with no floating ip option

Currently the option of selecting no floating IP will not apply to
a multimaster configuration and loadbalancers will be expected to use
floating IPs. This patch allows the floating IP resources to be
disabled among the load balancers.

Task: 22121
Story: 2002557
Change-Id: I8f96fba8aa41319ac209baedd9d3a927aad0eb91
(cherry picked from commit 393e70f0b0b12fe45b0271f2c2e53391d462076d)

commit_message:
Add back $WORKSPACE/logs directory creation

This is required to exist by the following line where we write
the fake subunit file. This works in CI because the directory is
created already, but fails in a reproducer environment. It seems
fine to just ensure this exists here.

Closes-Bug: #1778974
Change-Id: I8f03c14f1636a33162c8ea904714f6154ec3623a

commit_message:
ffu: Add missing nova-manage db sync for Pike upgrade

This would result in the failure of the online_data_migrations command
during the Ocata to Pike upgrade. The following Pike to Queens upgrade
would hide this failure by running both the sync and migrations again.

Change-Id: I51f40254acee435ed4e60c0e97b5ced86fd67fc2
Closes-bug: #1775868
(cherry picked from commit 65b758330862df75f7ed2ddceb7debb89ce792a6)

commit_message:
Fail yaml-validate.py on new deployments with outputs

Elevates the warning from yaml-validate.py about Heat deployment outputs
to an error now that config-download is the default. An exclusions list
is added to exclude those existing templates that use outputs, which
will be cleaned up in the Stein release.

Change-Id: I7249df36cb9391d8577432920a9bd33361a58f92

commit_message:
Deprecate templates replaced with config-download

The templates at extraconfig/pre_network/host_config_and_reboot.yaml
(replaced with extraconfig/pre_network/boot-params-service.yaml) and
extraconfig/tasks/ssh/host_public_key.yaml (replaced with the
tripleo-ssh-known-hosts role) are deprecated as they do not
work with config-download. They will be removed in the Stein release.

Change-Id: Ib66873ea4b0d86f12024ec16d788247c071cf3b5

[{'created': '2018-04-27 13:00:36.000000000', 'message': "Do not rely on defaults for DockerCephDaemonImage in CI.

When using mixed-versions deployment, as

"}]
commit_message:
Do not rely on defaults for DockerCephDaemonImage in CI.

When using mixed-versions deployment, as
it's the case for upgrades CI jobs. The
docker image version is being set by the
undercloud's tripleo-common package release.

As the undercloud is one release over the
overcloud, we end up deploying next's release
ceph docker image (ceph luminous in pike). By
setting the DockerCephDaemon parameter to the
right ceph docker image version we ensure that
the right version is being deployed

Closes-Bug: #1767329
Change-Id: Iff84601195722429f0e31334fee4845da0ca549c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-22 20:09:19.000000000', 'message': "Switch ansible tmp for local connections

With ansible 2.5.4, they introduced a change that causes the temp
directory used to not honor the HOME for a user. See
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/40363. Now the directory
defaults to ~/.ansible/tmp but using the HOME env has no effect. In our
case the code can be executed via mistral which doesn't have a valid
or writable home directory so it errors.  This change updates the
ansible_remote_tmp for the undercloud inventory file to
/tmp/ansible-${USER} to ensure it will work when running under mistral
but will work for any user as well.

The recommended fix for this is to configure the ansible_remote_tmp in
the inventory file for local connections to change this location.
Alternatively ANSIBLE_REMOTE_TMP can be used via an environment var but
that would change the location for all hosts which is not ideal.

Additionally HOME has been replaced with ANSIBLE_LOCAL_TEMP due to
changes upstream around the effect of home. See
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36755

Change-Id: Iaf1b8aa68af0274ba40eae329e32ab14f3689481
Closes-Bug: #1778269
"}, {'created': '2018-06-25 15:23:29.000000000', 'message': "Switch ansible tmp for local connections

With ansible 2.5.4, they introduced a change that causes the temp
directory used to not honor the HOME for a user. See
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/40363. Now the directory
defaults to ~/.ansible/tmp but using the HOME env has no effect. In our
case the code can be executed via mistral which doesn't have a valid
or writable home directory so it errors.  This change updates the
ansible_remote_tmp for the undercloud inventory file to
/tmp/ansible-${USER} to ensure it will work when running under mistral
but will work for any user as well.

The recommended fix for this is to configure the ansible_remote_tmp in
the inventory file for local connections to change this location.
Alternatively ANSIBLE_REMOTE_TMP can be used via an environment var but
that would change the location for all hosts which is not ideal.

Additionally HOME has been replaced with ANSIBLE_LOCAL_TEMP due to
changes upstream around the effect of home. See
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36755

Change-Id: Iaf1b8aa68af0274ba40eae329e32ab14f3689481
Closes-Bug: #1778269
"}]
commit_message:
Switch ansible tmp for local connections

With ansible 2.5.4, they introduced a change that causes the temp
directory used to not honor the HOME for a user. See
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/40363. Now the directory
defaults to ~/.ansible/tmp but using the HOME env has no effect. In our
case the code can be executed via mistral which doesn't have a valid
or writable home directory so it errors.  This change updates the
ansible_remote_tmp for the undercloud inventory file to
/tmp/ansible-${USER} to ensure it will work when running under mistral
but will work for any user as well.

The recommended fix for this is to configure the ansible_remote_tmp in
the inventory file for local connections to change this location.
Alternatively ANSIBLE_REMOTE_TMP can be used via an environment var but
that would change the location for all hosts which is not ideal.

Additionally HOME has been replaced with ANSIBLE_LOCAL_TEMP due to
changes upstream around the effect of home. See
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/36755

Change-Id: Iaf1b8aa68af0274ba40eae329e32ab14f3689481
Closes-Bug: #1778269

Apparently if the name of the firewall rule doesn't match the service
name then the rules don't get applied.

Change-Id: Iccb1f78508f1231b998d120fe1ccd6edb9e4a14b
"}, {'created': '2018-06-15 21:12:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix DNS firewall rules

Apparently if the name of the firewall rule doesn't match the service
name then the rules don't get applied.

Also, for DNS the rule needs to be udp, not the default of tcp.

Change-Id: Iccb1f78508f1231b998d120fe1ccd6edb9e4a14b
"}, {'created': '2018-06-20 16:34:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix DNS firewall rules

Apparently if the name of the firewall rule doesn't match the service
name then the rules don't get applied.

Also, for DNS we need both tcp and udp ports opened.

Change-Id: Iccb1f78508f1231b998d120fe1ccd6edb9e4a14b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DNS firewall rules

Apparently if the name of the firewall rule doesn't match the service
name then the rules don't get applied.

Also, for DNS we need both tcp and udp ports opened.

Change-Id: Iccb1f78508f1231b998d120fe1ccd6edb9e4a14b

commit_message:
Remove volume v1 API service client usage

Volume v1 API has been gone since long and Tempest also
marked their deprecation since Juno
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446238/

Now Tempest is removing the deprecated config option and
alias for voluem v1 service client in
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Before the Tempest patch gets merged, we need to remove all usage
of volume v1 things.

Change-Id: I843e6431b905a871eb286e6ae8b3cb4802932e36
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

override the configuration defaults.

commit_message:
Routed Networks - peer-subnet/segment host-routes (1/2)

Ensure that host routes are maintained for each subnet within
a network. Subnets associated with different segments on the
same network get's host_routes enties added/removed as
subnets are created, deleted or updated.

This change handle the host_routes for the subnet that is
created or updated.

Partial-Bug: #1766380
Change-Id: If6792d121e7b8e1ab4c7a548982a42e69023da2b

subject: Be able to set global default service region
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 8478, 'name': 'Vladislav Kuzmin', 'email': 'vkuzmin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkuzmin'}, {'_account_id': 10420, 'name': 'Adrian Turjak', 'email': 'devs+openstack@uncaught-exceptions.com', 'username': 'adriant'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-09 03:41:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-09 03:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-15 03:21:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-05-17 09:43:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2018-05-17 10:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-05-20 21:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-21 01:24:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Before this gets pushed through I'd just like to double check a few things."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-21 01:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

My concerns before we merge this:

Mostly, DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS appears to bypass the service_region set in the cookie, which means that if you set endpoints in the dict, they ALWAYS take precedence over the cookie. This feels like a bug, or a bad design choice since a user is always forced to login to the same region when they already had a cookie from their last session.

While I personally think the above situation (cookie isn't taking highest precedence) is a bug, this patch actually breaks that precedence a bit.

The precedence of service region for a logging in user with this patch would be:
1. specific endpoint matches in DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS
2. cookie with service_region
3. '*' key in DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS
4. some valid region as defined in catalog (mostly random)

This patch adds number 3. The problem is that this means a different value in DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS has a specific different precedence to all other values in the dict (although '*' has a special meaning in this case).

Potentially just doing a different setting may be clearer:
DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGION = 'RegionOne'

But then we have DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS and DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGION which may look confusing.

I don't know the context and design around DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS (added in pike? to openstack_auth?), but that dict taking precedence over a cookie feels like bad design unless allowing deployers the ability to 'force' a region on login every time (even when there is a cookie) was a requirement.

Ideally the precedence I expect or think makes the most sense is:
1. cookie with service_region
2. specific endpoint matches in DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS
3. '*' key in DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS (or some Global default service region setting)
4. some valid region as defined in catalog (mostly random)

Is there anyone who has more context around DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS and the requirements for it? This is the commit that added it: https://github.com/openstack/django_openstack_auth/commit/3227365bc66fdb2d8dbcdd8ccdee7a27aa058525

Then the bugs mentioned appear to be:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1703390
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1506825

The first bug makes it sound like the intended purpose was to have the dict take precedence over a cookie (which is bad design), and worse still the naming "default" implies that it's a fallback when a cookie isn't present.

Before we merge this I'm going to open a bug regarding the cookie not taking precedence and lets discuss and deal with that first before we merge this.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-21 02:09:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

added the bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1772345'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2018-05-21 13:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The only use of DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS update in this patch is to use it as a possible default value should the value not be present in the cookie. The second parameter of get is the value to return should the key provided by the first parameter not be found in the dictionary. I think the logic works out.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-22 02:25:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> The only use of DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS update in this patch is to
 > use it as a possible default value should the value not be present
 > in the cookie. The second parameter of get is the value to return
 > should the key provided by the first parameter not be found in the
 > dictionary. I think the logic works out.

Oh yeah, the change itself is tiny and safe. My main concern is that it means two quite different things are coming from DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS, and the order of precedence between the two isn't the same.

I still think this patch is the best way to handle a global default without adding a new setting, but I also thing we should address:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1772345

Unless forcing that setting to bypass the cookie is required by some deployment, and if it is I'd be VERY curious why, and I'd argue it's awful UX and we should seriously reconsider that."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-05-30 03:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've proposed an alternative option:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571086/"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-06-28 03:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

The alternative solution is better.'}]

commit_message:
Be able to set global default service region

DEFAULT_SERVICE_REGIONS is cumbersome when you have
more than one keystone endpoint and all you want to do
is set a global default service region.

This adds '*' as an optional fallback key to mean global default.
If an endpoint matches it will take precedence over the '*' value.

blueprint: global-default-service-region
Change-Id: Ia161335f9273793f0e0abc5664c8b90f5afec1ef

[{'created': '2018-06-27 21:56:57.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Auto VM engine for CoreOS CI jobs

The CoreOS ramdisk can take anywhere from 300-500 seconds to
startup depending on the size of the image and the underlying
hypervisor performance.

Given this time window, it is easy to cause the CI job to
timeout. Lets let the VM engine be chosen to use KVM if
available.

Change-Id: Ie4e096ccd71a3667fea34731cd5268b56e3cd2b9
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Auto VM engine for CoreOS CI jobs

The CoreOS ramdisk can take anywhere from 300-500 seconds to
startup depending on the size of the image and the underlying
hypervisor performance.

Given this time window, it is easy to cause the CI job to
timeout. Lets let the VM engine be chosen to use KVM if
available.

Change-Id: Ie4e096ccd71a3667fea34731cd5268b56e3cd2b9

[{'created': '2018-06-27 23:58:24.000000000', 'message': "Update TLS secret templates, remove nagios readiness probe

This updates the TLS secret templates to include the backend
service in the dict supplied to the manifest template, as it is
required for the TLS secret to render correctly.

This also removes the readiness probe from the nagios container in
the deployment for the nagios chart, as it wasn't functioning as
intended due to the port not being available for the probe

Change-Id: Iabcfd40c74938e0497d08ffeeebc98ab722fa660
"}]
commit_message:
Update TLS secret templates, remove nagios readiness probe

This updates the TLS secret templates to include the backend
service in the dict supplied to the manifest template, as it is
required for the TLS secret to render correctly.

This also removes the readiness probe from the nagios container in
the deployment for the nagios chart, as it wasn't functioning as
intended due to the port not being available for the probe

Change-Id: Iabcfd40c74938e0497d08ffeeebc98ab722fa660

commit_message:
Deprecate and unset the enabled_drivers option

The classic drivers are being removed, with the removal of pxe_ipmitool
already planned. The enabled_drivers option is deprecated in this change
and is made no-op, since there are no more classic drivers to enable
with it. We also force it to be empty, since the ironic team is planning
on a validate that is not set on ironic-conductor start up.

Change-Id: I6e02f59807c98643923d1c2333fcb25114735f25

[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-26 15:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-26 18:02:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

So the consumer is getting created, even though the overall operation fails?

Well, first off, that ^ shouldn't happen.  If the consumer doesn't exist beforehand and we do something that results in 4xx, the consumer shouldn't exist afterward either.  That, like, violates rules and stuff.

Second, we should always get the generation back post-1.28 if the status is 200.  If the consumer indicated by the URI doesn't exist, I would think it would be reasonable to 404; but if not, it should contain a generation of ``null``, because that's what you (should) have to send in to create the thing.

Third and beyond, I think we're getting into the territory of https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1778763 where we might start discussing creating explicit REST endpoints for consumers.

If zuul doesn't care about your trailing whitespace, you can fix it in the fup.  This test looks good."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-26 18:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 15:58:47.000000000', 'message': '[placement] demonstrate part of bug 1778591 with a gabbi test

The test creates a resource provider with a small amount of VCPU
inventory. It then tries to allocate a large number VCPU via a new
consumer (and thus using consumer_generation of null).

This fails with a 409 because capacity is violated.

Then it queries to GET allocations on that consumer, to see if consumer
generation is available. It is not.

The it tries to allocate a smaller amount and though it might be
expected that the generation should still be null, it takes a 0
for the allocation to be accepted.

Once we decide what the right behavior is here, we can fix it.

Change-Id: I196834efc2cb6ece4204abbf8544c8f2621aaa36
Related-Bug: #1778591

commit_message:
[placement] demonstrate part of bug 1778591 with a gabbi test

The test creates a resource provider with a small amount of VCPU
inventory. It then tries to allocate a large number VCPU via a new
consumer (and thus using consumer_generation of null).

This fails with a 409 because capacity is violated.

Then it queries to GET allocations on that consumer, to see if consumer
generation is available. It is not.

The it tries to allocate a smaller amount and though it might be
expected that the generation should still be null, it takes a 0
for the allocation to be accepted.

Once we decide what the right behavior is here, we can fix it.

Change-Id: I196834efc2cb6ece4204abbf8544c8f2621aaa36
Related-Bug: #1778591

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I0a7d0859d2052e5a8b4805e82e4370057bedf0b2
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit e3b9d19cbf318a7b9f9d356894d2264544dd93fe)

commit_message:
Remove conditional for tempfiles.d

The custom lock path conditional was getting in the way of laying down
general temp directories for services. This change removes the
conditional so the template will always be rendered as-is expected.

Change-Id: Id61bc748f3a1b5a7c43413347e6783105d62a2eb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update syntax to correct deprecation warnings

Ansible is now warning users to stop using a pipe when testing a
variable. This updates the syntaxt to be the latest recommended syntax.
This also corrects two tags that were misplaced.

Change-Id: I6aa855c5fdc57812b1a8ec5dd185941f82847103
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

I applied the patches to compute-0 and compute-1 and booted an instance with 16 vifs.  Live-migrating between these two compute nodes resulted in around 750 API calls to neutron.   I then live-migrated to compute-3 (without the changes) and that resulted in around 3200 neutron API calls.  Live-migrating between compute-3 and compute-4 failed due to RPC timeout, but I would estimate that it would be up around 5000 neutron API calls.

It appears this patch makes a significant difference.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-05-19 16:33:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note that there is still room for improvement...after the live migration it appears that we loop over all the ports twice, and we process the incoming events on both compute nodes.  This seems unnecessary.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-05-19 19:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(11:49:01 AM) cfriesen: mriedem: looking at my notes, that patch cut the neutron load by a factor of 3 and reduced lock contention in nova.  We also had an oslo.lockutils change to introduce fair locks--they merged it but then it seemed to cause mysterious issues in the CI for a couple of projects so they reverted it.
(11:49:44 AM) mriedem: how many ports on that instance?
(11:49:47 AM) mriedem: in that test?
(11:50:22 AM) cfriesen: actually, wait, that factor of 3 reduction was for removing redundant calls for the same instance
(11:51:52 AM) cfriesen: 16 ports on the instance (our max)
(11:57:15 AM) cfriesen: mriedem: found some numbers.  as of april last year each call to get_instance_nw_info() cost roughly 200ms plus about 125ms per port.  And without that patch there are O(N) network-changed events in a live-migration (where N is the number of interfaces), so the overall cost is O(N^2)
(11:57:23 AM) cfriesen: with that patch, it drops to O(N)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-10 14:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

[{'created': '2017-05-18 02:52:49.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Handle network-changed event for a specific port

It turns out that when Neutron sends the "network-changed"
event it has a port in scope and can provide the port ID.

Older versions of Neutron wouldn't send this, but if it's
provided, we can try to optimize the network info cache
refresh and scope it to just that single port, rather than
build the entire cache all over again when the other ports
in the cache may not have changed at all since the last
time the cache was refreshed.

Depends-On: Ifdaef05208d09ddd9587fed6214cf388e5265ba4

Change-Id: I023b5b1ccb248e68189f62ba0ff75d41093c1f60
Partial-Bug: #1691602

commit_message:
Handle network-changed event for a specific port

It turns out that when Neutron sends the "network-changed"
event it has a port in scope and can provide the port ID.

Older versions of Neutron wouldn't send this, but if it's
provided, we can try to optimize the network info cache
refresh and scope it to just that single port, rather than
build the entire cache all over again when the other ports
in the cache may not have changed at all since the last
time the cache was refreshed.

This can be especially beneficial for instances with a
relatively large number of ports which are being migrated.

Depends-On: Ifdaef05208d09ddd9587fed6214cf388e5265ba4

Change-Id: I023b5b1ccb248e68189f62ba0ff75d41093c1f60
Partial-Bug: #1691602

commit_message:
Add line for PyCharm IDE in gitignore file

There was no entry in the gitignore file for JetBrains IDEs like PyCharm.
This patch adds an entry to ignore the .idea directory that is created
when the manila-tempest-plugin git tree is imported as a project into
PyCharm.

Change-Id: I1e185976f9d1467eefe96548a2e090d1dd30ffca

[{'created': '2018-06-19 12:01:33.000000000', 'message': 'Leverage log_file option to capture more UC logs

Undercloud deployment starts logging into its log file
too late, omitting log records from undercloud_config.
This is a problem as we want to log the commands for
install/upgrade deployments generated by undercloud_config.

Fix this via the log_file config or --log-file CLI options
used to configure oslo_log for undercloud_config to share
the logging configuration with main deployments.

Keep writing pre-flight check logs to stdout only (that
can be fixed later using the same approach with oslo_log).

Write install/upgrade logs into the same logfile and allow
custom logfile paths as well.

Change-Id: I340be11bc9471df22f038629679634c3542d34d6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Ideally, messages in stdout/stderr should not miss the
log file.

Fix this via the added custom undercloud_log_file config
(use --log-file for standalone CLI). Use those to
configure logging to a file.

undercloud config and preflight checks.

mimic oslo_log behavior defined for the main deployment
modules derived from openstack client classes, which

classless modules allowing them to log INFO+ be default.

commit_message:
Leverage log_file option to capture more UC logs

Undercloud deployment starts logging into its log file
too late, omitting log records from undercloud_config,
preflight checks. This is a problem as we want to log
at least the commands used for undercloud install/upgrade.
Ideally, messages in stdout/stderr should not miss the
log file.

Fix this via the added custom undercloud_log_file config
(use --log-file for standalone CLI). Use those to
configure logging to a file.

Fix missing formatting, like timestamps and source, for
undercloud config and preflight checks.

Write preflight/install/upgrade logs into the same
logfile.

Move the load oslo config method into shared utilities.
Add the configure logging shared utility for the classless
modules (w/o oslo_log supported). Such modules can
mimic oslo_log behavior defined for the main deployment
modules derived from openstack client classes, which
support logging to files natively and are not affected
by the subject issue. With an exception made for those
classless modules allowing them to log INFO+ be default.
So operators will have the pre-flight check
notes logged, for example.

Change-Id: I340be11bc9471df22f038629679634c3542d34d6
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix nova unit test data to conform to API response types

Nova API uses a mix of integers and strings for IDs (v2.1).
Some of the unit test data mistakenly used integers where
Nova API uses strings. This patch fixes the mismatches.

Reference: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/

Change-Id: I521fee8d6bf617bdee1460e57c03473da5c23033

commit_message:
Create folder for rootfs before extracting

When using the `unarchive` module, it seems to require that the folder
already exists before the extraction happens, which is leading to things
not working in the gate properly:

  dest '/var/lib/machines/centos-7-amd64' must be an existing dir

This patch creates a folder so that it can extract things happily!

Change-Id: I476ef9c1b54f3da0ae347aabbf526b35eb88e78a

Docker doesn't like it when the time shifts so if we're building
containers when the ntp time sync actually occurs it can lead to
deployment failures. To prevent this, let's force a ntpdate on the host
during step1 to ensure the hardware time is properly synced before
proceeding.

Change-Id: I812c7da90ae06120707fd8795a41e4fd867f510e
Closes-Bug: #1776869
(cherry picked from commit a866f55691c5871db335cd976c71d3429dbf62b1)

commit_message:
Add host prep step for ntp time sync

Docker doesn't like it when the time shifts so if we're building
containers when the ntp time sync actually occurs it can lead to
deployment failures. To prevent this, let's force a ntpdate on the host
during step1 to ensure the hardware time is properly synced before
proceeding.

Change-Id: I812c7da90ae06120707fd8795a41e4fd867f510e
Closes-Bug: #1776869
(cherry picked from commit a866f55691c5871db335cd976c71d3429dbf62b1)

commit_message:
Use wildcard to apply system-required template

We require all projects to have the system-required template ... unless
we aren't gating them which is the case for ansible/ansible and
kata-containers/proxy. That's a bunch of boilerplate though, and zuul
now supports wildcard project configuration.

Make a wildcard config that applies to every project starting with
openstack that contains system-required. Remove the projects that didn't
have anything but that.

Change-Id: Ic1099625ae0500657e01e7cf48bce1273f7e0e24

commit_message:
ironic: bugfix: ensure a host is set for volume connectors

Somehow, in some not fully understood case,
we have discovered that we are not storing a
host field for the volume connector information.

This information is largely required for logging,
and in some cases back-end driver relationships,
but previously we would only set the field in the
case that we have an IP address. That is not ideal
in that some users may be using other transport
mediums like fibre channel.

Change-Id: I17b1aaa26b7e7aff3ebb73fa10ab576149a00a3f
Related-Bug: #1766661

commit_message:
Consider hostdev devices when building metadata

Previously, device role tagging metadata would only be built for
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface and LibvirtConfigGuestDisk. This didn't
account for passed through PFs, which can also be tagged and appear as
<hostdev> in the libvirt XML. This caused device role tagging to not
work for PFs. This patch adds support for <hostdev> devices to
_build_device_metadata.

Change-Id: I24e5ff1b446f2ac41d589c026ce8ee8adad4bcbc
Closes-bug: 1743458
Closes-bug: 1694183

subject: Refactor _build_device_metadata

commit_message:
Refactor _build_device_metadata

This patch splits out interface and disk metadata generation into its
own function each, in preparation for handling hostdev metadata
generation in a subsequent patch. It also adds some debug logging.

Related-bug: 1743458
Change-Id: I318b9118c97d7bf2b61bc45698443e8d0255ff6f

commit_message:
libvirt: remove old rbd snapshot removal error handling

This removes some old TODOs from Mitaka made in change
I328d2c41696a9c0f090f822a51ea42fac83f62ec in order to ease
the upgrade for using rbd snapshots during resize. As the
comment being removed suggests, we're way past the point
of having pending resized instances that could hit this, so
it's a fair time to remove it.

Change-Id: I335a916bc53209b99bcc069e9f0559fe280f41d8

[{'created': '2018-06-27 14:13:41.000000000', 'message': 'Do not run API (functional) tests in the CI

These use the fake-hardware driver and do not provide any useful
coverage for ironic-lib. Furthermore, they fail because of trying
to change the hardware type without changing other interfaces.
In the ironic and ironic-tempest-plugin CI a separate job runs
there tests. Adjust the tempest regex to exclude them.

Change-Id: I522b86d534320d64224b4e1c3b920a7df490f20d
(cherry picked from commit 68f017f241edec67fdb78b0a95772e54e7d2d106)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not run API (functional) tests in the CI

These use the fake-hardware driver and do not provide any useful
coverage for ironic-lib. Furthermore, they fail because of trying
to change the hardware type without changing other interfaces.
In the ironic and ironic-tempest-plugin CI a separate job runs
there tests. Adjust the tempest regex to exclude them.

Change-Id: I522b86d534320d64224b4e1c3b920a7df490f20d
(cherry picked from commit 68f017f241edec67fdb78b0a95772e54e7d2d106)

commit_message:
Add helper method for testing node fields

This adds a helper method '_test_node_fields_hidden_in_lower_version())
to provide consistency and reduce the amount of copy/paste being used
for several of the unit tests.

Change-Id: I3d319cd1711fe10e9c92ab2076b9b415b7f3810c

commit_message:
Add snmp driver auto discovery

When instantiated, this new universal snmp driver chooses one
concrete snmp driver selected the prefix value of the
`SNMPv2-MIB::sysObjectID` MIB object looked up at the device.

Co-Authored-By: Ilya Etingof <etingof@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I9bf01a0c567048d0169db281684d16a00e39f6b8
Story: #1635644
Task: #10529

subject: Set ODL API restart policy to unless-stopped

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 13:33:51.000000000', 'message': "Set ODL API restart policy to unless-stopped

On minor update, when docker RPM or configuration gets updated, docker
daemon restarts, and if container has restart policy `always`, it is
started automatically. This meant that our previous aim of stopping
the container and cleaning cache was effectively undone by the docker
daemon restart later during execution of update_tasks.

Setting the restart policy to unless-stopped keeps the container
stopped on docker daemon restarts if the container was stopped
intentionally.

Additionally we don't use docker_container Ansible module anymore
because on CentOS we can hit this Ansible issue:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/27960

Co-Authored-By: Janki Chhatbar <jchhatba@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id033cbeef46bded13f4fd6c06eb3a244634f0e7b
Partial-Bug: #1775919
"}, {'created': '2018-06-13 13:34:56.000000000', 'message': "Set ODL API restart policy to unless-stopped before stopping it

On minor update, when docker RPM or configuration gets updated, docker
daemon restarts, and if container has restart policy `always`, it is
started automatically. This meant that our previous aim of stopping
the container and cleaning cache was effectively undone by the docker
daemon restart later during execution of update_tasks.

Setting the restart policy to unless-stopped keeps the container
stopped on docker daemon restarts if the container was stopped
intentionally.

Additionally we don't use docker_container Ansible module anymore
because on CentOS we can hit this Ansible issue:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/27960

Co-Authored-By: Janki Chhatbar <jchhatba@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id033cbeef46bded13f4fd6c06eb3a244634f0e7b
Partial-Bug: #1775919

started automatically. This meant that our previous aim of stopping
the container and cleaning its cache was effectively undone by the
docker daemon restart later during execution of update_tasks.

Setting the restart policy to `unless-stopped` keeps the container
stopped on docker daemon restarts if the container was stopped
intentionally.

Co-Authored-By: Janki Chhatbar <jchhatba@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id033cbeef46bded13f4fd6c06eb3a244634f0e7b

commit_message:
Set ODL API restart policy to unless-stopped

On minor update, when docker RPM or configuration gets updated, docker
daemon restarts, and if container has restart policy `always`, it is
started automatically. This meant that our previous aim of stopping
the container and cleaning its cache was effectively undone by the
docker daemon restart later during execution of update_tasks.

Setting the restart policy to `unless-stopped` keeps the container
stopped on docker daemon restarts if the container was stopped
intentionally.

Co-Authored-By: Janki Chhatbar <jchhatba@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id033cbeef46bded13f4fd6c06eb3a244634f0e7b
Partial-Bug: #1775919

commit_message:
Restore Sphinx in upper-constraints.txt

This is a partial revert of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575337/ .

Doc jobs for certain projects are failing with Sphinx 1.7.4,
saying "Field list ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent."
I don't see anything obviously wrong in those rst files.
They work fine with 1.6.5.

Similar change in the past: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568248/

Related-Bug: #1771092
Change-Id: Ia2261f674f06cf551f05320f8b6ced2796c4dbce

Rename default stack name for standalone

Move the undercloud stack name into the undercloud installation rather
than have it be the default for the standalone deployment method.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 14:13:44.000000000', 'message': "Enable warnings-as-errors for publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-python3

We have detection for setting the warnings-as-errors flag if a repo
has warnings set in their setup.cfg, but with the current PTI
recommendations, that setting should now be removed from setup.cfg.

This has resulted in projects merging doc changes that pass the
gate jobs, but are then broken when doc builds are run locally
using tox -e docs.

Since we can't enable this for all repos without getting failures
currently, and since we both want to eventually move to python 3
and remove warnings, this sets the flag to enable errors only on
the python 3 job to give some flexibility to opt in to running
this way.

See also discussion here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129146.html

Change-Id: I7724492985a0ceb2d95f0781ee46659e9a571989
"}, {'created': '2018-05-01 19:48:37.000000000', 'message': "Enable warnings-as-errors for publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-python3

This has resulted in projects merging doc changes that pass the
gate jobs, but are then broken when doc builds are run locally
using tox -e docs.

Since we can't enable this for all repos without getting failures
currently, and since we both want to eventually move to python 3
and remove warnings, this sets the flag to enable errors only on
the python 3 job to give some flexibility to opt in to running
this way.

See also discussion here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129146.html

Change-Id: I7724492985a0ceb2d95f0781ee46659e9a571989
"}]
commit_message:
Enable warnings-as-errors for publish-openstack-sphinx-docs-python3

We have detection for setting the warnings-as-errors flag if a repo
has warnings set in their setup.cfg, but with the current PTI
recommendations, that setting should now be removed from setup.cfg.

This has resulted in projects merging doc changes that pass the
gate jobs, but are then broken when doc builds are run locally
using tox -e docs.

Since we can't enable this for all repos without getting failures
currently, and since we both want to eventually move to python 3
and remove warnings, this sets the flag to enable errors only on
the python 3 job to give some flexibility to opt in to running
this way.

See also discussion here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129146.html

Change-Id: I7724492985a0ceb2d95f0781ee46659e9a571989

commit_message:
Update introduction documention page

A lot has changed in Octavia since the parapgrahs this patch touches on
were written. We should encourage operators and end-users to use Octavia
as first-class load balancing solution in OpenStack rather than
misleading new users by recommending them to use Neutron LBaaS with
Octavia as provider driver, at least whenever possible. A note is left,
though, for operators and end-users already running Neutron LBaaS to
migrate either to Octavia or, if not immediately possible, use the
Octavia proxy plugin in neutron-lbaas.

Change-Id: Ia7c6bca86d9510ce077295074fe9b034c6b35f54

commit_message:
Slightly increase job timeouts

Given there can be variability, and we've seen some
indications of timeouts, extending the overall timeouts
a little bit in order to avoid hitting any issues.

This likely won't fix the ironic-lib gate, but may give
us additional understanding of what is occuring.

Also has a dependeny placed on the IPA tinyipa build script
fix.

Depends-On: I139679db835b7a87c55f69a4d807ff8ec9099e3a
Change-Id: I2cd4c3ccf9e6e071b255635657c6ac292cc7aa29

commit_message:
VMAX Driver - Incorrect SSL cert verification

SSL certificates are not being applied to the REST session as desired.
If a user sets SSL verification to True but does not specify a path
to the SSL cert, SSL is disabled instead of looking in the system
certificate bundle.

Closes-Bug #1772924

Change-Id: I20cb64c11e43c22558939e27708ec678c5723ca2

commit_message:
Revert "Remove unnecessary code from toci_* scripts"

This patch broke the libvirt reproducer

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1778974

This reverts commit 8c6db50589997386f77f65e3a6388c8f97b9945d.

Closes-Bug: #1778974

Change-Id: Iaf5ca29bbe70ad6efa150abd4114b6d1108401d3

commit_message:
Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.

Change-Id: Ib0a90f51e6290bc5f46679cfb9e34662585ac26c
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Services LBaaS driver:  fix ensure LB for existing LB.

The 'ensure_loadbalancer' function of LBaaS driver should support
both new and existing LBs.
This patch updates  'ensure_loadbalancer' to support properly
existing LBs.

Change-Id: I083c58130b4a374bd4c80047aa158ba4eef14968
Closes-Bug: 1778516

subject: Add heat-manage expire_events
messages:
[{'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-21 21:46:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-21 21:48:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-21 23:44:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Can you elaborate on why this is needed?

We already purge events automatically since I4fb2fefbd9bcd10ce1767ddf58a870206a6482a1 in the Havana release.

Also there's no tests."}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-26 22:26:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Can you elaborate on why this is needed?
 > 
 > We already purge events automatically since I4fb2fefbd9bcd10ce1767ddf58a870206a6482a1
 > in the Havana release.
 > 
 > Also there's no tests.

The only difference I see is cap per stack vs remove older events (overall), but that still seems redundant.
I am trying to reach out to the original committer to get the intent here, If we are not able to justify, then i'll abandon this. 
Thanks for the review."}, {'account_id': 15435, 'date': '2018-06-27 13:26:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

You can abandon this. It was implemented to provide predictability for overall event database size, comparable to ceilometer.   It was more noticable back before 0fa81c2f950a37328b9386e2683580c9f5d48ebc was submitted in kilo.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-27 17:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

That makes sense. Thanks Al for the clarification!'}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-27 18:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Al for confirming, abandoning.'}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2018-06-27 18:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

We are already purging events, hence this change is not needed.'}]

commit_message:
Add heat-manage expire_events

Add a heat-manage expire_events action to remove older heat events

Current default is 30000
To change to 100 this would be the entry in heat.conf
[expirer]
max_events=100

Change-Id: I8d9bee833ef6716d3368de7a50afc7eb7c23e107
Story: 2002644
Task: 22344

commit_message:
ffu: Add missing nova-manage db sync for Pike upgrade

This would result in the failure of the online_data_migrations command
during the Ocata to Pike upgrade. The following Pike to Queens upgrade
would hide this failure by running both the sync and migrations again.

Change-Id: I51f40254acee435ed4e60c0e97b5ced86fd67fc2
Closes-bug: #1775868

thanks Dmitry, lgtm, one question I'm haunted by, we also have `manage_firewall` config option, so possible to have case when manage_firewall=false and default manage_boot=True. Could we handle this?"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2016-07-11 13:51:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> possible to have case when manage_firewall=false and default manage_boot=True. Could we handle this?

In this case we don't update firewall, but we do call set_boot_device"}, {'account_id': 13636, 'date': '2016-07-13 08:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

btw, is there use case for this? imo there is misunderstanding in terms here, `manage_boot`  manage firewall and set boot device for this node, but there is also manage firewall option, which has side effect on this, so maybe mentioning this in docs'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2016-07-15 09:37:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I've found a use case: https://review.openstack.org/201904 could benefit from the new flag even if we don't finish the whole ironic side of the boot management spec.

As to documentation, we don't document manage_firewall at all. I think I'll write a separate chapter on both options in a follow-up, if there are no other comments here."}, {'account_id': 13636, 'date': '2016-07-18 09:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add manage_boot parameter to introspection API

Adds a new node field "manage_boot" to store this value. When it is set
to False, neither boot device nor power state are touched for this node.
Instead, we expect a 3rd party to handle them.

We still manage the PXE filter because the node may need DHCP.

Change-Id: Id3585bd32138a069dfcfc0ab04ee4f5f10f0a5ea
Story: #1528920
Task: #11338

commit_message:
Allow fast forward upgrade of custom roles

- adjust the templates to allow passing custom roles file when
  running fast forward upgrade operations
- instead of running Controller role only upgrade all roles
  except compute and ceph roles

Change-Id: I15ec672279af992af75e52b68e4c390816b56469
(cherry picked from commit 5a7e5aaab35158ec1a199ca4d5176d61fa5021bf)

commit_message:
Ensure appropriate ACL mask is set on CephX keyrings

Changing group permissions alters the ACL mask, causing the "read"
permission we set explicitly for the openstack users to be ignored.

This change ensures "read" is set for the ACLs mask.

Change-Id: I4f94a3f7ab2c55a8c45363b8354be99d52980a7b
Closes-Bug: 1775549

Use tempest-multinode-full parent for multinode Zuul jobs

This patchset uses the recently added [0] tempest-multinode-full
parent for multinode Patrole Zuulv3 jobs. This patchset also
fixes some trivial docstring errors related to [1].

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545724/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570262/

Change-Id: Ib13663b582f0c57a28ec4b18129b83ab5ba95cfe

[{'created': '2018-06-14 22:35:42.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Self recover from the loss of 'fg' ports in FIP Namespace

Sometimes we have seen the 'fg' ports within the fip-namespace
either goes down, not created in time or getting deleted due to
some race conditions.
When this happens, the code tries to recover itself after couple
of exceptions when there is a router_update message.
But after recovery we could see that the fip-namespace is
recreated and the 'fg-' port is plugged in and active, but the
'fpr' and the 'rfp' ports are missing which leads to the
FloatingIP failure.

This patch will fix this issue by checking for the missing devices
in all router_updates.

Change-Id: I78c7ea9f3b6a1cf5b208286eb372da05dc1ba379
Closes-Bug: #1776984
"}, {'created': '2018-06-15 21:31:03.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Self recover from the loss of 'fg' ports in FIP Namespace

commit_message:
DVR: Self recover from the loss of 'fg' ports in FIP Namespace

Sometimes we have seen the 'fg' ports within the fip-namespace
either goes down, not created in time or getting deleted due to
some race conditions.
When this happens, the code tries to recover itself after couple
of exceptions when there is a router_update message.
But after recovery we could see that the fip-namespace is
recreated and the 'fg-' port is plugged in and active, but the
'fpr' and the 'rfp' ports are missing which leads to the
FloatingIP failure.

This patch will fix this issue by checking for the missing devices
in all router_updates.

Change-Id: I78c7ea9f3b6a1cf5b208286eb372da05dc1ba379
Closes-Bug: #1776984

bridge is configured in neutron.

When external bridge is configured, the vlan tag should be removed

commit_message:
DVR: FIP gateway port is tagged as DEAD port by OVS with external-bridge

FIP agent gateway port is tagged as a DEAD port by OVS when external
bridge is configured in neutron.

When external bridge is configured, the vlan tag should be removed
after the port is plugged in.

This patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I969b9d7e7cef4beff526a2b26de3f1a9f9de4c1c
Closes-Bug: #1778643

commit_message:
Change Neutron tests to use multi-policy support

This change changes the test cases that require multi-policy and
multiple error code handling.

Partially Implements: bp rbac-testing-multiple-policies
Story: 2002620

Change-Id: I40df70f7cd7c7f30822010323c5dd02697d50d2b

commit_message:
Add --stack to update, upgrade and ffwd-upgrade 'run' CLI.

We need to be able to define the stack name if it
is different than 'overcloud', for the ansible inventory
used with the upgrade playbooks.

Change-Id: I8b7e319d635b133b1973207bbf3ba9d282d93f10
Closes-Bug: 1767379

networking-ovn optionally expects list of dns server to be defined in the
config -'ovn/dns_servers'. These will be included in the 'dns_server' DHCP
option field when the VMs send DHCP request if the subnet's dns_nameservers field
is not defined by the user.

Change-Id: I353ac905069ecc945720df2b9e3051989238a02a
Partial-bug: #1774052
(cherry picked from commit b2b8cf72a891da3e22e5361e8706d33bdffd6198)
"}]
commit_message:
ovn: Add dns_servers configuration support

networking-ovn optionally expects list of dns server to be defined in the
config -'ovn/dns_servers'. These will be included in the 'dns_server' DHCP
option field when the VMs send DHCP request if the subnet's dns_nameservers field
is not defined by the user.

Change-Id: I353ac905069ecc945720df2b9e3051989238a02a
Partial-bug: #1774052
(cherry picked from commit b2b8cf72a891da3e22e5361e8706d33bdffd6198)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-19 03:30:48.000000000', 'message': "[doc] Modify the description for the command

The displayed image attributes of the command 'openstack image list'
do not has 'Server', so this patch remove it. The available status
of image should be 'active' according to the output of the command.

Change-Id: I90efd2b3f1838cdcaa79feea78d73429cded1257
(cherry picked from commit 6f858c3cf748285690b95c6d17a56c7e45589992)
"}]
commit_message:
[doc] Modify the description for the command

The displayed image attributes of the command 'openstack image list'
do not has 'Server', so this patch remove it. The available status
of image should be 'active' according to the output of the command.

Change-Id: I90efd2b3f1838cdcaa79feea78d73429cded1257
(cherry picked from commit 6f858c3cf748285690b95c6d17a56c7e45589992)

commit_message:
Deprecated ceilometer::dispatcher::gnocchi

Gnocchi dispatcher options will be removed upstream very soon [1].

But the depracted options are still used in puppet-ceilometer and tht.

This change marks the deprecation here.

Change-Id: I7674e390c7c821ff9855c133b3594a1ad951ddeb

[{'created': '2018-06-20 14:23:10.000000000', 'message': 'aclfixer.py: Document standing exceptions

Deliverables under TC governance should have their release
process handled by the Release Management team. However, there
are a number of exceptions to the rule: deployment tools may
have their artifacts released using an ecosystem-specific
toolchain. Some teams might be in the process of leaving TC
governance and adjusting their ACLS would be counter-productive.

Change-Id: Ia304de2eea2364a990b17343879fe26b904706e1
'}]
commit_message:
aclfixer.py: Document standing exceptions

Deliverables under TC governance should have their release
process handled by the Release Management team. However, there
are a number of exceptions to the rule: deployment tools may
have their artifacts released using an ecosystem-specific
toolchain. Some teams might be in the process of leaving TC
governance and adjusting their ACLS would be counter-productive.

Change-Id: Ia304de2eea2364a990b17343879fe26b904706e1

commit_message:
DiskAdapter Parent Class In-tree Backports

This contains backports for code changes made during in-tree driver
DiskAdapter parent class development [1].

- Forces subclasses to implement capacity methods
- Marks abstract methods/properties in the parent class
- Introduces a fake disk adapter to allow testing with abstract methods
  and properties.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/549053/

Change-Id: I1f8ebe64571c009020be7f3888167e3450d2fd4d

commit_message:
SUSE: Add support for openSUSE Leap 15

This also ensures that the OBS Virtualization repository is only created
for Leap 42.X since Leap 15.X already contains the necessary LXC
packages in the standard repos. Finally, we don't use the major version
for the Leap 15 files since there is a currently a bug in Ansible[1]
which returns 'NA' as major version for Leap 15.

This patch does not add any jobs since there is a circular dependency
with the lxc_container_create role. Once Leap 15 is supported in that
role, we will add jobs in this role as well.

[1]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/41410
Change-Id: I64e38ac7b7e8dec81b5f637301df8a112aa03d9b

 > nova/wsgi.py
 > 
 > I'm sure we're picking it up through a cascading dependency, but we
 > probably want to add it explicitly.
 > 
 > Not in this patch, though.
 > 
 > Please just fix up the commit header and I'm +2.

@Eric, it is there in requirement.txt [1]. My question was same as Stephen, does doc building really need oslo.service ?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/351faa959fc228c726848a68e6ea3f3dadde025e/requirements.txt#L50"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-27 02:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 25562, 'date': '2018-06-27 02:52:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I don't see nova/doc depends on oslo.service either :("}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-27 03:27:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Sheesh, not sure what I was looking at before, I see it in requirements.txt now.

But it sounds like it's not actually needed for doc build?  So... abandon this?  What's happening here?"}, {'account_id': 21723, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Humm, I recreated my environment in a separate container and nova docs compiles without this change. I will abandon this. Sorry for the hassle.'}, {'account_id': 21723, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This was a false alarm.'}]

commit_message:
Adding oslo.service to doc requirements

Doc building requires oslo.service and it is missing from the
documentation requirements.

Change-Id: Ifdedfcbd66e49c96a42745362a6d90fba4d77ef1
Signed-off-by: Gergely Csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>
