- http://logs.openstack.org/61/565161/9/check/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/4656b65/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-20_16_25_40_794447

- /home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-docs/doc/source/install/basic_deployment/tempest.rst:507:Bullet list ends without a blank line; unexpected unindent."}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2018-06-21 16:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-06-21 16:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-25 15:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-06-25 15:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I have another general disagreement about this content landing entirely in tripleo-docs. If the tempest part is not going to the tempest.git repository, it should land into the tempestconf repository, and referenced from there.
Landing "Generating tempest.conf using discover-tempest-config" and other sections would let tripleo-docs have more documentation on tempestconf than tempestconf itself.

Anyway, as my -1 is not going to go anywhere, can we agree at least to remove the "alien" sections when/if they land on the more specific projects?'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2018-06-26 15:50:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I've created a story [1] to track, that we need to improve python-tempestconf's docs and move some parts from this documentation, or at least put here a reference to python-tempestconf's docs, after they are created. But it's not our priority now as this review needs to be reviewed and merge ASAP.

About the other alien parts, after a discussion during a tripleo-tempest scrum meeting, we agreed, that those parts can stay there. TripleO/quickstart user doesn't have to go through the whole Tempest documentation then, but can see only relevant commands for his use case with quickstart/tripleo on one page. 
This does NOT mean, that we shouldn't improve Tempest docs and copy there some parts of this documentation, if they are not already there. But that's again, not the priority right now.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2002703"}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2018-06-26 15:50:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-06-26 17:03:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

small change needed.. We can't have folks pulling from the rdo registry.  That registry is not built for high traffic."}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2018-06-26 17:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2018-06-26 19:50:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-06-27 08:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2018-06-27 13:58:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-27 14:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2018-06-27 14:27:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

(17 comments)

Great info - some nitpick comments in line. Can be addressed later'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

@Chandan, please follow up with fixes for Ronelle'}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2018-06-27 15:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(2 comments)

Thank you Ronelle for pointing out the mistakes. I proposed a patch with the fixes - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578443/'}]

commit_message:
Added Tempest Documentation for Tripleo

* It covers how to run tempest using tripleo-quickstart as well as
  running manually.
* It removes ancient tempest docs.

Change-Id: I72aedfe45ab6cd600f1244dfddad2d13216b5155

commit_message:
Add openstack_auth to translations update

This PR adds the openstack_auth directory to the list of directories
that are being updated when we run a translations update.

Change-Id: I332af52b0aea589d966d0d12b9eea6431828d02e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/576891
Closes-Bug: #1776944

commit_message:
remove yum priority

In the past we were using priority in order to mask package from epel.
now we only install epel with a very limited list of allowed pkg and only when
needed. This patch set the priority to 99 for COPR repo.

Depends-On: Ie05dc74a36619cbd88204c4909e540c736431b6c
Depends-On: Ic6525e013b96e00d115d13a2b9e8fb00c3000127
Depends-On: I2e42ef4022aaaa2e1cb9f461e63ce2e9e1f49511
Change-Id: Ifca03344bfab8442a11b1c82443427c164b9bd57

commit_message:
Snapshot In-tree Backports

This contains backports for code changes made during in-tree driver
instance snapshot development [1].

- Renames boot_disk_path_for_instance() to get_bootdisk_path() for
  clarity
- Makes disk_match_func() private and static
- Renames instance_disk_iter() to _get_bootdisk_iter() and remove
  unnecessary parameters.
- Other minor cleanup

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543023/

Change-Id: I8f2eef1063b7e40c0cd71fc4adb04cbf6d35ece1

commit_message:
Switch to official ElasticSearch Ansible role

There is an official role published by Elastic for deploying it,
we should be using that instead.

Change-Id: I241a3a84e84a5b475e14154e475f4598ba1d64cb

commit_message:
Remove old Ansible code replaced by native task feature

The calls we were doing to update_cache are no longer necessary
as they were written in a time before Ansible 2.0 existed and
faciliated all these things.

Change-Id: I7d465ea5905025e55defef1351441f9ecc0683c4

commit_message:
Run all tests without containers

There is not much of a reason for us to run these tests in
containers, we can speed things up a lot more if we ran them
outside containers.

Depends-On: I6259dc91b4830c3bff9e9661837673f95c45ba86
Change-Id: I23589e283f229ed355017cc79999cfcdc5bfc6f9

commit_message:
Refactor to use integration classes

This patch will refactor the testing of classes to use the same
ones used in integration to make sure that things are always
consistently tested everywhere (and fixes for CI land globally).

Depends-On: I4da527e66494c671539b91d682505442b7b82bcd
Change-Id: I00002af38265b5791cab95cd91f1ac157cd3d61a

commit_message:
Add support for configuring MariaDB

This enables:

* Disabling MariaDB if external MariaDB is used
* Merging additional configuration with the default Kolla
  provided configuration for MariaDB

commit_message:
Handle AgentNotFoundByTypeHost exception properly

During listing router_ids on host it is possible that on some hosts
there are no L3 agents.
In such case AgentNotFoundByTypeHost exception is raised in
neutron.db.agents_db module in _get_agent_by_type_and_host() method.
Now this exception is properly handled during listing routers on host.

Change-Id: Ia5ff1b57ef63c98b4ada4f2d46c45336e413be3d
Closes-Bug: #1737917
(cherry picked from commit 7b0f6330d6f877f3d2093a64c2bca4c14334574c)

[{'created': '2018-02-20 17:49:37.000000000', 'message': "Drop API compat handling for old compute error cases

Change Ibcb6bf912b3fb69c8631665fef2832906ba338aa dropped
the compute RPC API code for checking old computes from the
API and raising specific errors if the API is trying to perform
some action on an instance running on an old compute that can't
handle that action.

With that change, the API now expects that computes should be
able to handle at least Queens level operations, i.e. the
can_send_version checks for those operations in the compute RPC
API code would not be False.

Since those compute RPC API checks are removed, the handling in
the API is dead code now, so we can cleanup that handling.

Change-Id: Ibd05139c5f6a0548f17e24d3807746b93d76f446

commit_message:
Drop API compat handling for old compute error cases

Change Ibcb6bf912b3fb69c8631665fef2832906ba338aa dropped
the compute RPC API code for checking old computes from the
API and raising specific errors if the API is trying to perform
some action on an instance running on an old compute that can't
handle that action.

With that change, the API now expects that computes should be
able to handle at least Queens level operations, i.e. the
can_send_version checks for those operations in the compute RPC
API code would not be False.

Since those compute RPC API checks are removed, the handling in
the API is dead code now, so we can cleanup that handling.

Change-Id: Ibd05139c5f6a0548f17e24d3807746b93d76f446

commit_message:
Add dummy docstrings to avoid Sphinx 1.7.x warnings

We need to workaround this locally because:
- It's unclear how long os-vif patch [1] will take
  to be merged.
- While Neutron patch [2] has been merged, docs build on
  gate is using released versions of dependencies.

The idea was taken from keystone. [3]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577028/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577029/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578121/

Related-Bug: #1771092
Change-Id: I2d125ce2251473f896fc251b8fa51cfa29721850

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 10:37:48.000000000', 'message': 'Do not run API (functional) tests in the CI

These use the fake-hardware driver and do not provide any useful
coverage for ironic-lib. Furthermore, they fail because of trying
to change the hardware type without changing other interfaces.
In the ironic and ironic-tempest-plugin CI a separate job runs
there tests. Adjust the tempest regex to exclude them.

Change-Id: I522b86d534320d64224b4e1c3b920a7df490f20d
'}]
commit_message:
Do not run API (functional) tests in the CI

These use the fake-hardware driver and do not provide any useful
coverage for ironic-lib. Furthermore, they fail because of trying
to change the hardware type without changing other interfaces.
In the ironic and ironic-tempest-plugin CI a separate job runs
there tests. Adjust the tempest regex to exclude them.

Change-Id: I522b86d534320d64224b4e1c3b920a7df490f20d

commit_message:
[LLDP] Skip NICs that say they are ready but are unreadable.

While listening for LLDP packets, if one of the sockets marks itself as
ready to read then our code will try to read data from that socket, but
if something goes wrong while reading that data then it causes IPA to
raise out of the loop skipping any other of the other NICs which might
have worked. This patch adds code to catch and LOG any exception that is
raised while we are trying to read data from one of the sockets so that
we can proceed to process all the NICs.

Conflicts:
	ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_netutils.py

Change-Id: I8546097f5ae23755a5fdb448902007a2d823b7bf
Closes-Bug: #1665025
(cherry picked from commit b536fbba616d958e58b110c8f86ea569f8834d7c)

commit_message:
[LLDP] Skip NICs that say they are ready but are unreadable.

While listening for LLDP packets, if one of the sockets marks itself as
ready to read then our code will try to read data from that socket, but
if something goes wrong while reading that data then it causes IPA to
raise out of the loop skipping any other of the other NICs which might
have worked. This patch adds code to catch and LOG any exception that is
raised while we are trying to read data from one of the sockets so that
we can proceed to process all the NICs.

Change-Id: I8546097f5ae23755a5fdb448902007a2d823b7bf
Closes-Bug: #1665025
(cherry picked from commit b536fbba616d958e58b110c8f86ea569f8834d7c)

commit_message:
[WIP] Port Keystone Utilities to mistral-extra

This patch ports the keystone utilities commonly needed by actions
that interact with OpenStack clients.  It's currently a work in
progress and requires tests.

Change-Id: I16760100f2518e5d39d930b99cd206e1a5611bc6

commit_message:
Add FirstContact SIG liaison duty for PTL

FirstContact SIG needs to have each project liaison to have
a dedicated person for new contributors interested in their project.

This commit adds the PTL responsibility to allocate the
project liaison in FirstContact SIG.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131264.html

Current liaison list: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/First_Contact_SIG#Project_Liaisons

Change-Id: If7fc3b0d58aeccc9db1c99e1e51366ee2c3b0235

subject: Don't tag create cephkeys_access_group tasks
messages: [{'account_id': 2799, 'date': '2018-06-18 11:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14749, 'date': '2018-06-18 18:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nThank you Andy'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-19 03:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2018-06-27 12:58:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 11:03:40.000000000', 'message': "Don't tag create cephkeys_access_group tasks

When skipping the ceph-install tag the cephkeys_access_group is still
required, but won't be created.

None of the tasks that utilize the cephkeys_access_group are tagged so
we should not tag the task to create teh cephkeys_access_group. This
will prevent a situation where a tag is skipped and the group is not
created as a result.

Closes-Bug: #1776212
Change-Id: I83efd8fb637735c37c6c2f1c530cc59cb7bd9067
"}]
commit_message:
Don't tag create cephkeys_access_group tasks

When skipping the ceph-install tag the cephkeys_access_group is still
required, but won't be created.

None of the tasks that utilize the cephkeys_access_group are tagged so
we should not tag the task to create teh cephkeys_access_group. This
will prevent a situation where a tag is skipped and the group is not
created as a result.

Closes-Bug: #1776212
Change-Id: I83efd8fb637735c37c6c2f1c530cc59cb7bd9067

commit_message:
Unpin ansible-lint

We have a probelm with current yaml version and ansible-lint
TypeError: unbound method construct_mapping() must be called with Constructor instance as first argument (got Loader instance instead)

Related-Bug: 1778865

Change-Id: Idc84a354914f62ff8d223dc181ef6cd9ca83797f

The zmq publisher was removed.

commit_message:
Remove redundant line from dragonflow config

Dragonflow is configured to work with both redis and zmq, it should only
work with one.
This configuration is not optimal, and causes the gate to fail.
The zmq publisher was removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578195
Change-Id: I006529c4e30ef6c4e604fe4ffe15cf53a67f62ae

commit_message:
Fix health server binding address

Flask update changed the default binding address from 0.0.0.0 to
127.0.0.1. This affects Kuryr's healthchecks as we were depending on
that behavior. This manifested with Kuryr pods being constantly
restarted.

This commit fixes that by explicitly binding to 0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I298960c2e84befe74c35b32bcc6730ba27202604
Related-Bug: 1778516
Closes-Bug: 1778867

commit_message:
Cleanup CI jobs for IPA

Renamed jobs to more appropriate names, and extended
base timouts, as well as the build timeouts for coreos
as the image we work with today is a little larger
than it was previously.

Change-Id: I2884ba795bae689b40826b8c7e2714e3eb5811fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-22 17:57:42.000000000', 'message': "During cleaning, use current node.driver_internal_info

When iterating over the clean steps, the code in the conductor
keeps a copy of the node's driver_internal_info and uses that
to update the node's copy. However, it is possible that the
node's driver_internal_info is modified after the copy is made.
This patch changes it to use the current node's driver_internal_info.

Change-Id: I92ad67b58343e5c6c1cca916269f134a5c78dcc6
"}, {'created': '2018-06-25 16:39:55.000000000', 'message': "During cleaning, use current node.driver_internal_info

When iterating over the clean steps, the code in the conductor
keeps a copy of the node's driver_internal_info and uses that
to update the node's copy. However, it is possible that the
node's driver_internal_info is modified after the copy is made
(e.g. if a driver's clean step method modifies/saves it).
This patch changes it to use the current node's driver_internal_info.

Story: #2002688
Task: #22513
Change-Id: I92ad67b58343e5c6c1cca916269f134a5c78dcc6
"}, {'created': '2018-06-26 14:08:06.000000000', 'message': "During cleaning, use current node.driver_internal_info

keeps a copy of the node's driver_internal_info and uses that

node's driver_internal_info is modified after the copy is made
(e.g. if a driver's clean step method modifies/saves it).
This patch changes it to use the current node's driver_internal_info.

Task: #22513
Change-Id: I92ad67b58343e5c6c1cca916269f134a5c78dcc6
"}]
commit_message:
During cleaning, use current node.driver_internal_info

When iterating over the clean steps, the code in the conductor
keeps a copy of the node's driver_internal_info and uses that
to update the node's copy. However, it is possible that the
node's driver_internal_info is modified after the copy is made
(e.g. if a driver's clean step method modifies/saves it).
This patch changes it to use the current node's driver_internal_info.

Story: #2002688
Task: #22513
Change-Id: I92ad67b58343e5c6c1cca916269f134a5c78dcc6

commit_message:
Use `manage.py migrate` for django versions >= 1.9

`syncdb` subcommand was deprecated in django 1.7
and subsequently removed in 1.9.

Use `subprocess.check_call()` so we catch errors.

Add `shared-db` relation and enable debug logging in deployment
used in functional test.  Add functional test that authenticates
through the dashboard.

Update unit tests.

Change-Id: I567461e57ec431fc470d7a2a31d3f16e9dc50e8b
Closes-Bug: #1777358
(cherry picked from commit db9fac5f4b5558c17dc08ea6a8619a5a54f12bf5)

commit_message:
Temporarily retry initial connect in test 400

There is a eluding issue that currently makes the
first request to the OpenStack Dashboard error out
with 500 Internal Server Error in CI.  Temporarilly
add retry logic to unwedge the gate.  This issue
should be revisited and root caused properly when time
allows.

Change-Id: Id828082416c7cbdd88247d9b6750c0f77467bc26
(cherry picked from commit 293f297b090105b6763a3de0cff0d196a9678b65)

commit_message:
Run openstack_openrc before Magnum installation

The Magnum role attempts to upload images for the operation of
Magnum, however, the role for openrc is installed after magnum
which means the role cannot use the 'default' cloud profile
to upload images.

This patch adjusts the order so that the os_magnum role is able
to upload images.

Closes-Bug: #1778463
Change-Id: I10846e5844c2f02c1a5450eaa950b3704672c324
(cherry picked from commit 1fd26bc0e841a8cf65715f6236eef53bed4ed71a)

messages:
[{'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2018-06-27 08:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What are the implications of this change for upgrades?'}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:23:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> What are the implications of this change for upgrades?

Sorry ,I did't get it, would u mind explain more?"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-27 09:32:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > What are the implications of this change for upgrades?
 > 
 > Sorry ,I did't get it, would u mind explain more?

If I have a cloud deployed at Queens, and I upgrade to rocky, my virtual router ID will change during the upgrade. There may be a time when one keepalived service has the old ID and another has the new one, but both manage the same VIPs. What will happen? Will there be a problem?"}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-06-27 10:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

is not backwards compatible, if i upgrade to next release, the new id may cause conflict with an existing keepalived service in the same network.

Commonly the 51 id is used around every keepalived deployment, so network engineers already knows they need to change that value if a new environment is deployed. If we use a random id, they will need to dig if any other instance causes conflicts or not'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-06-27 10:37:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> is not backwards compatible, if i upgrade to next release, the new
 > id may cause conflict with an existing keepalived service in the

 > 
 > Commonly the 51 id is used around every keepalived deployment, so
 > network engineers already knows they need to change that value if a
 > new environment is deployed. If we use a random id, they will need
 > to dig if any other instance causes conflicts or not

Looks like we document this: https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/user/multinode.html#deploying-kolla'}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2018-06-27 11:00:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

make sense, thanks mark, Eduardo. abandon this.'}, {'account_id': 17549, 'date': '2018-06-27 11:00:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Generate default execution id

When execution id is not sent by the client, the api
will generate source execution id

Change-Id: Iae1ff327b5cb1af857d53ca53782d9fb30eefc27
Closes-Bug: #1774164

commit_message:
Stop enabling the ironic's pxe_ipmitool driver

Both the driver and the enabled_drivers options are being removed
this week. Stop setting them to avoid breakages.

Change-Id: I0e0bf851424b8f5839b159ef83f1cc65c30e2fb3

commit_message:
Send a zaqar message with 'list_validations' result

Workflow 'list' from 'validations' workbook is supposed
to be used in tripleo-ui, so the message is required in
this case.

Change-Id: I474f3fe5fbdf3758bc2cc61d6f60a36bbb025dab

commit_message:
Create zuul-hosts file for pre.yaml network setup

Add a template to create a hosts file in the format that
Zuul would create the inventory. The pre.yaml playbook for
multinode, that sets up the vxlan networking, requires the
inventory file to be in this format.

Change-Id: Idefd3646951a295449fa5eafd26edfe722705102

commit_message:
Include --xattrs when creating the undercloud backup.

We need to use --xattrs when running the backup, otherwise
swift objects after the restore won't be accesible.

Change-Id: I62e5488c78c95368f6b6b967a5504ff3478f1fce
Closes-Bug: 1778215

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 16:38:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure we start nova-compute after ironic-conductor.

We need to ensure that ironic-conductor starts before nova-compute.
This is to workaround an issue where nova-compute tries and fails to
call plug_vifs, this in turn report a vm_state error which, in this
case is a false positive.  See lp#1777608 for more.

We ensure ordering by forcing puppet to restart nova-compute after
ironic-conductor in the case of undercloud upgrade/update.

Change-Id: Ifbada53f088258a397777a6fa18dd7c1b37c09d3
Closes-Bug: #1777475
(cherry picked from commit 801fb3ced610cfdec9a19dc7b5296677f18904fe)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure we start nova-compute after ironic-conductor.

We need to ensure that ironic-conductor starts before nova-compute.
This is to workaround an issue where nova-compute tries and fails to
call plug_vifs, this in turn report a vm_state error which, in this
case is a false positive.  See lp#1777608 for more.

We ensure ordering by forcing puppet to restart nova-compute after
ironic-conductor in the case of undercloud upgrade/update.

Change-Id: Ifbada53f088258a397777a6fa18dd7c1b37c09d3
Closes-Bug: #1777475
(cherry picked from commit 801fb3ced610cfdec9a19dc7b5296677f18904fe)

commit_message:
Introduce l3_logging extension base

This patch introduces base class for L3 logging extension base.
It will be used for SnatLogExtension and FWaaSLogExtension.

Change-Id: I5372fa4d93f51692cebc9dc4df5b4fe79b1ef554
Related-Bug: #1720727

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-21 09:20:07.000000000', 'message': 'Provide timestamps in Ansible output by default

Add a new configurable `profile_tasks` argument for
AnsiblePlaybookAction that controls output of profiling
information. The default for the new option is True, as it's likely
that this will be a universally useful default for deployment,
updates, upgrades, etc.

Also a `profile_tasks_limit` argument is added to control final output
of slowest executing tasks in the playbook. Since we want to optimize
for production scenarios and operators can hardly affect the run
times, this argument defaults to 0.

The combination of the above will give us time stamps for each task
but no "what are the slowest tasks" by default.

Both options are overridable by extra_env_variables, which might be
useful in some cases, especially for the callback whitelist.

Change-Id: If8abc8c2406e152004c7bce1d116bc8690ac1cf7
Closes-Bug: #1777467
(cherry picked from commit 5dac6edf85c71df2f2cf722ae41e8018701a51c1)

commit_message:
Provide timestamps in Ansible output by default

Add a new configurable `profile_tasks` argument for
AnsiblePlaybookAction that controls output of profiling
information. The default for the new option is True, as it's likely
that this will be a universally useful default for deployment,
updates, upgrades, etc.

Also a `profile_tasks_limit` argument is added to control final output
of slowest executing tasks in the playbook. Since we want to optimize
for production scenarios and operators can hardly affect the run
times, this argument defaults to 0.

The combination of the above will give us time stamps for each task
but no "what are the slowest tasks" by default.

Both options are overridable by extra_env_variables, which might be
useful in some cases, especially for the callback whitelist.

Change-Id: If8abc8c2406e152004c7bce1d116bc8690ac1cf7
Closes-Bug: #1777467
(cherry picked from commit 5dac6edf85c71df2f2cf722ae41e8018701a51c1)

commit_message:
Don't resolve outputs when getting stacks

A few workflows are retrieving the overcloud stack with its outputs,
while not using them. This can make for a big result, so pass the
resolve_outputs flag to disable it.

Change-Id: I5deac641dbbc5552bb52f3e27a13b9dee5c1be4a
Related-Bug: #1774958
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/573306

commit_message:
Missing puppet restart resource definition in scenario000.

This add the forgotten the service restart definition for post puppet
change in the pacemaker scenario000 definition.

This should impact master job mainly.  No obvious error for not having
this file, but may have new one by including this more correct
definition of pacemaker resource.

Change-Id: I9c63823a941623ff7196500f3642f04a7b3228a2

commit_message:
Adding missing pacemaker definition for scenario000.

During queens jobs upgrade, we install the overcloud using the pike
tripleo heat templates.  So we need this scenario000 to have the
pacemaker resource definition in order for the queen upgrade ci to
work.

Change-Id: Id067bb7a365ebfd1f8cb9d8d3c4518accaa3fa5b
Closes-bug: #1777132

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I0a7d0859d2052e5a8b4805e82e4370057bedf0b2
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit e3b9d19cbf318a7b9f9d356894d2264544dd93fe)

[{'created': '2018-06-26 13:48:52.000000000', 'message': "Update API reference for os-floating-ip-pools

The os-floating-ip-pools API is implemented for both
nova-network and neutron. When using neutron, it justs
lists external network names.

Since it's a deprecated proxy to neutron we won't remove
it as part of blueprint remove-nova-network, but we can
update the API reference to explain how to achieve the
equivalent functionality in the networking service API,
so that's done here.

Change-Id: Ieb4c7a0657929f66ed5b642c5941e65aee24372d
"}]
commit_message:
Update API reference for os-floating-ip-pools

The os-floating-ip-pools API is implemented for both
nova-network and neutron. When using neutron, it justs
lists external network names.

Since it's a deprecated proxy to neutron we won't remove
it as part of blueprint remove-nova-network, but we can
update the API reference to explain how to achieve the
equivalent functionality in the networking service API,
so that's done here.

Change-Id: Ieb4c7a0657929f66ed5b642c5941e65aee24372d

commit_message:
Fix API reference for os-floating-ip-dns

The generic warning in here about being a proxy to
neutron is incorrect since these APIs don't proxy
anything to neutron and won't work if you're using
neutron, so the warning is updated.

Part of blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I8b7638bb0835711ef174d6caf1b53e4a1808ef53

commit_message:
Fix API reference for os-floating-ips-bulk

The generic warning in here about being a proxy to
neutron is incorrect since these APIs don't proxy
anything to neutron and won't work if you're using
neutron, so the warning is updated.

Part of blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I6f88108ba81dfb8f47fb56a35aa6abc2bad0d710

placement: Make API history doc more consistent

- Make use of the 'versionchanged' directive to note when a change was
  introduced
- Format URLs, HTTP commands as literals
- Reword some sections

Additionally added autoconf, autogen, automake, and libtool
to the build requirements as the new ipmitool package is based

commit_message:
Switch from sourceforge to github for ipmitool

Currently CI fails on build ipa image on xenial, because downloading
with wget from sourceforce is giving SSL error. Start using the
github mirror, that is not having this problem.

Additionally added autoconf, autogen, automake, and libtool
to the build requirements as the new ipmitool package is based
off of repository commit history tags and did not contain
a pregenerated configure file.

Change-Id: I139679db835b7a87c55f69a4d807ff8ec9099e3a
(cherry picked from commit 80be07ae791980a1c444b3b0d685775c1688ca34)

commit_message:
Switch from sourceforge to github for ipmitool

Currently CI fails on build ipa image on xenial, because downloading
with wget from sourceforce is giving SSL error. Start using the
github mirror, that is not having this problem.

Additionally added autoconf, autogen, automake, and libtool
to the build requirements as the new ipmitool package is based
off of repository commit history tags and did not contain
a pregenerated configure file.

Change-Id: I139679db835b7a87c55f69a4d807ff8ec9099e3a
(cherry picked from commit 80be07ae791980a1c444b3b0d685775c1688ca34)

commit_message:
Switch from sourceforge to github for ipmitool

Currently CI fails on build ipa image on xenial, because downloading
with wget from sourceforce is giving SSL error. Start using the
github mirror, that is not having this problem.

Additionally added autoconf, autogen, automake, and libtool
to the build requirements as the new ipmitool package is based
off of repository commit history tags and did not contain
a pregenerated configure file.

Change-Id: I139679db835b7a87c55f69a4d807ff8ec9099e3a
(cherry picked from commit 80be07ae791980a1c444b3b0d685775c1688ca34)

commit_message:
Ensure _get_changed_synthetic_fields() return updatable fields

Currently _get_changed_synthetic_fields() does not guarantee
returned fields to be updatable. This patch adds this guarantee.

Change-Id: I123ae390bec489a931180a2e33f4bf7b1d51edb2
Closes-Bug: #1750353
(cherry picked from commit d5f27524819bc95530d0d5856782546fd02d65f8)

commit_message:
Revert "Remove keystone_authtoken section for aodh"

This reverts commit f8fd06011aed5cd9028a8c1e206762a78e137df7.

Based on the code, overall uses service_credentials, but looks like a
few parts is using keystonemiddleware.auth_*

Closes-Bug: #1775956

Change-Id: I766a5624737cae892fe77fa8151b20e0972ed5b2

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-19 05:49:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

What I mean is, we *have* an element that is supposed to regenerate dracut [1].  If we can possibly keep things like regeneration to one place that would be much better.

If this module uses "element-deps" to depend on that module, then it seems like it should be able to do the regeneration on its behalf.  It seems to me that it just needs to be communicated to the dracut-regenerate element to include "network iscsi".  and should be able to be done via setting something like:

DIB_DRACUT_ENABLED_MODULES+="
- network
- iscsi"

in this element?

That way, if several things want to add modules to dracut like this, they all append to the list, and then it only gets done once at the end.


[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/diskimage_builder/elements/dracut-regenerate
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/diskimage_builder/elements/dracut-regenerate/README.rst#n6'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2018-06-20 04:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2018-06-20 04:23:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Add iscsi-boot element for CentOS images

This patch adds an element that handles the configuration for
creating a disk capable of being a remote root filesystem through
iSCSI on CentOS images.

Tested on Fujitsu Server and boot with BIOS and UEFI mode successfully.
- Tested Boot-From-Volume + EFI for centos7 with following elements:
  "centos7 vm devuser cloud-init-datasources dhcp-all-interfaces
   iscsi-boot dracut-regenerate block-device-efi"

Co-authored-By: Nguyen Van Trung <trungnv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Ia1f23d722dced6f254fd7aee86abe8066a72fa42

write_prometheus provides an exporter to be scraped by
prometheus.

Change-Id: Ibd3bc04f3cedbcf3e029579877f60e90eb7081e1

commit_message:
Service assurance plugins and write_prometheus

This enables to send metrics and events to AMQP 1.0.
write_prometheus provides an exporter to be scraped by
prometheus.

Change-Id: Ibd3bc04f3cedbcf3e029579877f60e90eb7081e1

commit_message:
Add status check for creating volume backup

When creating volume backup from volume or snapshot, the status of the
source volume or snapshot will be changed to 'backing-up', and will be
changed to volume or snapshot's original status after the backup
creation finished. So it is necessary to add status check for the source
volume or snapshot to make the tests more robust.

Change-Id: I0add3989e1184012b908c5fab459cda41194dec3

commit_message:
Remove unused images

The following images have no reference in kolla-ansible, and there
appears to be no blueprints open to indicate they are being worked on:

* almanach
* certmonger
* dind
* qdrouterd
* rsyslog

The following images are from the now discontinued kolla-kubernetes:

* helm-repository
* kube
* kubernetes-entrypoint
* kubetoolbox

Change-Id: I34dc5d0fa7c33d49741dda563f9325b65d8d95a5

We've switched everything to python-openstackclient and therefore
the usage of python-cinderclient is no longer necessary.

commit_message:
Adds a separate admin network

The admin network is intended for remote admin access to
the overcloud hosts e.g SSH. If admin_oc_net_name is not set
it will default to provision_oc_net_name for backwards
compatability.

Story: 2002096
Task: 19774

Change-Id: Ib04bbc07f97218d7503000cc363624c60c287822

commit_message:
Remove volume v1 API service client usage

Volume v1 API has been gone since long and Tempest also
marked their deprecation since Juno
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446238/

Now Tempest is removing the deprecated config option and
alias for volume v1 service client in
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Before the Tempest patch gets merged, we need to remove all usage
of volume v1 things.

Change-Id: Ibbb57073676c81aa27e0bc1ac0d9bac7b1852e96
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Do not use relation_ids directly

Use a for loop to handle relation_ids for the case when the
relationship has not yet been created.

Closes-Bug: #1777508
(cherry picked from commit 1c4d99123235d9f4334a05988982d0dac54ebbd3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 03:32:15.000000000', 'message': 'Cluster peers notify readiness

The percona-cluster charm was rendering, and therefore, restarting
after each peer joined. This causes race conditions with the leader
handing out client credentials.

This is due to the parallel but conflicting goals of building the
cluster as quickly as possible but also delaying client relations until
the full cluster is completely ready.

The charm relied on the bootstrap_uuid being set among peers. However,
the bootstrap_uuid is set intentionally early in pursuit of the first
goal building the cluster quickly. It did not signify true readiness.

This change adds another peer relation setting, "ready", that each node
sets when it has bootstrapped, its hacluster is complete, and it has a
sufficient number of peers.

The cluster is considered ready when (min-cluster-size) peers have
indicated readiness. This fulfils goal number two delaying client
relations until the full cluster is ready.

Change-Id: I0998407fcb5efbdb0f7734ac39363e8d41088c79
Closes-Bug: #1775682
(cherry picked from commit 055d2bb17fc7fc4025842eaf6444417643d3937a)
'}]
commit_message:
Cluster peers notify readiness

The percona-cluster charm was rendering, and therefore, restarting
after each peer joined. This causes race conditions with the leader
handing out client credentials.

This is due to the parallel but conflicting goals of building the
cluster as quickly as possible but also delaying client relations until
the full cluster is completely ready.

The charm relied on the bootstrap_uuid being set among peers. However,
the bootstrap_uuid is set intentionally early in pursuit of the first
goal building the cluster quickly. It did not signify true readiness.

This change adds another peer relation setting, "ready", that each node
sets when it has bootstrapped, its hacluster is complete, and it has a
sufficient number of peers.

The cluster is considered ready when (min-cluster-size) peers have
indicated readiness. This fulfils goal number two delaying client
relations until the full cluster is ready.

Change-Id: I0998407fcb5efbdb0f7734ac39363e8d41088c79
Closes-Bug: #1775682
(cherry picked from commit 055d2bb17fc7fc4025842eaf6444417643d3937a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 14:01:22.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup v18.0.0 release notes' prelude

The v18.0.0 tempest release notes had cluttered the prelude section with
random details about a OVS feature. This did not belong in the prelude
because this section is for high level details about the release. This
normally just is things like adds support for release X, or removal of
unsupported release W. This commit attempts to clean this up by moving
the comments about the rationale for a flag to the feature release
notes for the new flag.

Change-Id: I4831688b55d1e106880b0e4e6998c407eb60fc17
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup v18.0.0 release notes' prelude

The v18.0.0 tempest release notes had cluttered the prelude section with
random details about a OVS feature. This did not belong in the prelude
because this section is for high level details about the release. This
normally just is things like adds support for release X, or removal of
unsupported release W. This commit attempts to clean this up by moving
the comments about the rationale for a flag to the feature release
notes for the new flag.

Change-Id: I4831688b55d1e106880b0e4e6998c407eb60fc17

commit_message:
Use `member` instead of `Member`

Keystone now provides a set of default roles in addition to `admin`
by default [0]. This is done during the `keystone-manage bootstrap`
process.

This change aligns the `Member` role override from devstack with the
`member` role provided from keystone.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572243/

Change-Id: I3da3530aa73a8a1500116bcefdcba7b947d5e05e
Closes-Bug: 1777359

(3 comments)

I think we need running code here instead of adding just framework without usage. 
What you can do
- Add framework of validating the schema with unit tests 
- unit tests should cover the complete coverage of framework. 
- Add a single schema in this patch and try to validate the API with that.

This was can check UT and can verify that schema validation is happening correctly.'}, {'account_id': 25571, 'date': '2018-05-29 05:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-13 03:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-13 03:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

as i commented in PS4, you should do at least those to have this in shape of debugging

- Add framework of validating the schema with unit tests
unit tests should cover the complete coverage of framework.
Add a single schema in this patch and try to validate the API with that.'}, {'account_id': 25571, 'date': '2018-06-13 12:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 25571, 'date': '2018-06-13 15:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-27 05:08:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

while debugging the error and looking at WSME (first time for me), very first question comes to mind is do we need JSON schema validation ?

WSME + Pecan is being used in watcher API framework and which itself does the request param validation with good amount of type and value range checking. 

There are may way to perform the strict validation for request schema. In OpenStack we use following options:

1. wsgi + JSON Schema.
This is used in Nova. We use self defined wsgi API framework in nova and so we use JSON schema for request body validation[1].

2. Pecan + WSME
This can do validation using WSME. In this you can define the request schema in WSME way like:
class AuditCreateSchema:
    name = types.wsattr(types.StringType(min_length=1, max_length=255, pattern='^[a-zA-Z0-9_.- ]*$'), mandatory=True)
    id = types.wsattr(types.StringType(min_length=0, max_length=255), mandatory=True)

This is what used in Watcher [2].

3. Pecan - WSME + JSON Schema. 
This is where Pecan is used for API gateway and JSON schema can be used for request body validation. 

As mentioned above, Watcher use options 2 (WSME + Pecan) and all the request body validation is already done in watcher using WSME. My question is why we need to do duplicate validation using JSON Schema. 

may be we all(including me when i asked Aditi and Rajat about JSON schema idea for Watcher APIs) overlooked the validation part which is already done in Watcher[2] while reviewing the spec.  

Can we reiterate the spec and decide-
- nothing to do here for valdiation
- watcher want to convert the WSME validation to JSON schema validation ?  

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/24c1b541ee6634612d012a382dde2f8060439f9b/nova/api/openstack/compute/admin_actions.py#L70

[2] https://github.com/openstack/watcher/blob/0c4231e4221a63ff1927a0191a5e65b09367b7c6/watcher/api/controllers/v1/audit.py#L57"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-06-27 05:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

validation is happening here -

https://github.com/openstack/watcher/blob/0c4231e4221a63ff1927a0191a5e65b09367b7c6/watcher/api/controllers/v1/audit.py#L468

https://github.com/openstack/wsme/blob/7498845c680c4342faff4fdbbc7cf7d2df9efa9f/wsmeext/pecan.py#L66'}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2018-06-27 06:09:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 12:22:46.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Add LXC and PIP mirrors"

This reverts commit f55c977161a40695703095d8f156984ea74e02d9.

1. lxc_reverse_proxy as a variable is only used in role tests, not the integrated build. The integrated build sets it differently [a] and already uses the reverse proxy when appropriate [b].

2. pip_default_index in the integrated build uses the repo container and should not be overridden. The repo build process makes use of the repo_build_default_pip_index which is already set to use the infra mirrors [c].

3. pip_wheel_mirror as a variable is only used in role tests, not the integrated build. The integrated build makes use of the repo container instead, and uses the wheel mirror during the repo build process [d][e].

commit_message:
Revert "Add LXC and PIP mirrors"

This reverts commit f55c977161a40695703095d8f156984ea74e02d9.

1. lxc_reverse_proxy as a variable is only used in role tests, not the
   integrated build. The integrated build sets it differently [a] and
   already uses the reverse proxy when appropriate [b].

2. pip_default_index in the integrated build uses the repo container
   and should not be overridden. The repo build process makes use of
   the repo_build_default_pip_index which is already set to use the
   infra mirrors [c].

3. pip_wheel_mirror as a variable is only used in role tests, not the
   integrated build. The integrated build makes use of the repo
   container instead, and uses the wheel mirror during the repo build
   process [d][e].

[a] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/32aa42507643b4f1feae422cfebb82a53f5f0515/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2#L153-L157
[b] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/2696a5186b0edca650829a51a2bf8c828b945c5c/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml#L106-L114
[c] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/2696a5186b0edca650829a51a2bf8c828b945c5c/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml#L89
[d] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/2696a5186b0edca650829a51a2bf8c828b945c5c/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml#L95-L104
[e] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible/blob/32aa42507643b4f1feae422cfebb82a53f5f0515/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2#L183-L187

Change-Id: I817fcc534a040bdfe7aee52eb4ad00620b386aeb

commit_message:
[placement] Add test demonstrating bug 1778743

Add a suite of gabbit tests which demonstrate that it is possible to
violate inventory constraints in a POST to /allocations. Subsequent
patch will have a fix with the test adjusted to reflect the proper
behavior.

Change-Id: Ie6510deac262e040a56caedb5f21e414e897ed70
Related-Bug: #1778743

commit_message:
Add upgrade support for Vitrage

1. Devstack plugin now supports upgrade
2. Grenade job is added based on legacy dsvm job

Additional tests for resourses will be added in a following patch.

Task: #22494
Story: #2002676
Change-Id: I93cb85d66cbae9fb19a275a66a9f8dff8e935f3c

[{'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-05-08 18:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24427, 'date': '2018-05-10 00:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I was looking for this ps. thanks'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-05-10 08:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Tested locally, seems to work fine'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-17 19:27:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-05-17 22:27:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Our unit test (https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/unit/cmd/test_sanity_check.py) was ineffective in catching the problem because by the time it called https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py#L31, all the groups were already loaded. To demonstrate this, I added a print line after https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py#L31 as follows:

print cfg.CONF._groups.keys()

And then I ran the unit test:

tox -e py27 neutron.tests.unit.cmd.test_sanity_check.TestSanityCheck.test_setup_conf

This is the output I get:

['AGENT', 'OVS', 'network_log', 'ml2', 'QUOTAS', 'oslo_messaging_amqp', 'SRIOV_NIC', 'profiler', 'LINUX_BRIDGE', 'service_providers', 'oslo_policy', 'agent', 'FDB', 'oslo_messaging_notifications', 'l2pop', 'oslo_messaging_rabbit', 'ml2_type_vlan', 'xenapi', 'ml2_type_flat', 'ml2_type_vxlan', 'ml2_type_geneve', 'oslo_messaging_zmq', 'nova', 'matchmaker_redis', 'oslo_concurrency', 'designate', 'oslo_versionedobjects', 'SECURITYGROUP', 'placement', 'ml2_type_gre', 'VXLAN', 'macvtap', 'privsep', 'database', 'QOS']

Please note that the 'ml2' group that is reported as not found in bug 1769868 is already loaded. Whereas running the neutron-sanity-check tool I got the following:

$ neutron-sanity-check
['OVS', 'nova', 'placement', 'AGENT', 'profiler', 'xenapi', 'privsep', 'oslo_concurrency']

Note that the 'ml2' section is not preloaded. 

Based on this, I suggest that we modify the unit test, adding just after line https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/unit/cmd/test_sanity_check.py#L22:

sanity_check.cfg.CONF = cfg.ConfigOpts()

Obviously this means we have to import:

from oslo_config import cfg

With this change, when we get to https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py#L31 we can see that no config groups have been loaded:

tox -e py27 neutron.tests.unit.cmd.test_sanity_check.TestSanityCheck.test_setup_conf
[]
{0} neutron.tests.unit.cmd.test_sanity_check.TestSanityCheck.test_setup_conf [0.090417s] ... ok

And we are effectively testing that setup_conf() loads the required groups"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-05-17 22:38:41.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-05-18 02:58:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-05-18 18:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix exception in neutron-sanity-check

When the config options were all moved to neutron/conf
the neutron-sanity-check script was not updated.  Have
it use the registration methods directly.

Change-Id: Ie45ce0faa17ee4cfe8d2a1dce442b032efea0041
Closes-bug: #1769868

commit_message:
Don't enable unbound when not in the packages_list

Some scenarios (009-multinode) require running their own dnsmasq/dns
cache. Running unbound by default conflicts with these scenarios. This
patch allows for removing unbound from packages_list and skip the enable
step.

Change-Id: I88836db12509d8aea4bac8b6209d6d275f5aabb1

commit_message:
Don't install unbound as it conflicts with origin

Unbound listens on port 53, which clashes with the origin-node dns cache
service. Don't install unbound and let origin-node do its thing.

Depends-On: I88836db12509d8aea4bac8b6209d6d275f5aabb1
Change-Id: I02c76c5252db1ebef58786967bdc694c9fa6a0d5

commit_message:
Explicitly set threaded=False when starting Flask

Due to global-requirements update kuryr-daemon got broken as it's now
required to explicitly set threaded=False when starting multi-process
Flask app. This commit fixes that. Please note that this change should
not break older versions of Flask.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578195
Change-Id: I11e0b8b6e66ede00f08e182e4e3f4829c2936e1f
Closes-Bug: 1778483

   playbook inclusions in site.yml. TIL that using include_playbook

2. Use include_tasks instead of include for the openstack-image-setup

3. Switch to using 'is' instead of '|' for tests.

Change-Id: I6d68bd4fecda122a77f7934842c3479a4c0792fd

commit_message:
MNAIO: Resolve all Ansible 2.5-related deprecation warnings

To resolve the warnings, we:

1. Use import_playbook instead of include for the conditional
   playbook inclusions in site.yml. TIL that using include_playbook
   does not work with conditionals.

2. Use include_tasks instead of include for the openstack-image-setup
   task set inclusion.

3. Switch to using 'is' instead of '|' for tests.

Change-Id: I6d68bd4fecda122a77f7934842c3479a4c0792fd

commit_message:
Nova/Libvirt: mount vm state directories with bidirectional propagation

This PS updates the Nova and Libvirt charts to mount the vm state
directories with bidirectional mount propagation for k8s >= 1.10.
This allows mounts created by some volume drivers to be used, and
unaffected by pod restart.

Change-Id: Idaf664efb23a424dd8d9e1376ea7231b8565e3fe
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

subject: MNAIO: Improve change/error handling for VM define/create
messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-26 11:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-26 13:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 290, 'date': '2018-06-26 14:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7414, 'date': '2018-06-26 19:10:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'd prefer we abandon this one in favor of my changes which use the virt module and provide better error handling: https://review.openstack.org/578162"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-06-27 06:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned in favor of https://review.openstack.org/578162'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 11:19:32.000000000', 'message': "MNAIO: Improve change/error handling for VM define/create

Currently the define/create tasks output a bunch of error data
which is ignored due to 'failed_when: false' being set. But
legitimate errors will also get ignored.

This patch improves the failure conditions and implements a
changed_when condition too so that re-running the playbooks
gives a cleaner and less confusing output.

Change-Id: Ia733e2258b1c1e2c01aab814cf1f6b264a1f7505
"}]
commit_message:
MNAIO: Improve change/error handling for VM define/create

Currently the define/create tasks output a bunch of error data
which is ignored due to 'failed_when: false' being set. But
legitimate errors will also get ignored.

This patch improves the failure conditions and implements a
changed_when condition too so that re-running the playbooks
gives a cleaner and less confusing output.

Change-Id: Ia733e2258b1c1e2c01aab814cf1f6b264a1f7505

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: Ie47d63619ab599c6fac63a33b6cdf60336a3e236

I also don't understand what you mean by " tenant 1d6799399ce34204a6d3970f20d7e529" in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-05-18 04:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-05-18 04:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi kevin
Thanks for the review. Updated a new patch. I was just trying to give an example nova list --tenant <any tenant id> in the commit msg.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-05-18 04:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-05-28 13:04:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

IMO, it should be fixed in nova side at first.

If you have the patch for nova, please add the change ID in the commit message.
Even in that case, '--all-tenants' should not be removed in the nova CLI command."}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-05-29 04:56:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

 > commit message.

 > nova CLI command.

Thanks for the comment. I came to the solution with the help of the below spec that changing in nova client will be a good option.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198184/."}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-05-29 06:42:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-05-29 08:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-05-30 08:39:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:05:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-05-31 05:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 27078, 'date': '2018-05-31 10:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me!'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-05-31 14:06:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I'm concerned about the code removed in check_resources.py allowing resources to be left around.

Also, I just looked at the bug, and I don't understand how this change relates to the reported bug.  According to my reading, the bug is that, in order to use --tenant, one must also give --all-tenants; this change just removes the --all-tenants option entirely.  I'm pretty sure we still want to be able to list VMs owned by all tenants, so I'm not sure what you're trying to accomplish with this change."}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-06-01 04:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-06-01 04:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I'm concerned about the code removed in check_resources.py allowing
 > resources to be left around.
 > 
 > Also, I just looked at the bug, and I don't understand how this
 > change relates to the reported bug.  According to my reading, the
 > bug is that, in order to use --tenant, one must also give
 > --all-tenants; this change just removes the --all-tenants option
 > entirely.  I'm pretty sure we still want to be able to list VMs
 > owned by all tenants, so I'm not sure what you're trying to
 > accomplish with this change.

Hi Kevin.The bug is about Flag "all_tenants" should not be required for "tenant_id" or "user_id" filter to function properly. Thanks'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-06-01 04:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2018-06-01 04:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2018-06-01 14:02:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Yes, but my point is that we still want to be able to list all tenants; the bug, as I understand it, is that --tenant and --all-tenants should be independent, and using --tenant shouldn't imply --all-tenants, so completely removing the option doesn't make sense.  Finally, removing an option without a deprecation period breaks backwards compatibility."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2018-06-04 05:40:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

> Yes, but my point is that we still want to be able to list all tenants; the bug, as I understand it, is that --tenant and --all-tenants should be independent, and using --tenant shouldn't imply --all-tenants, so completely removing the option doesn't make sense.

I agree with it.

No requirement of all-tenants while listing servers

Removing --all-tenant from when doing nova list  tenant
1d6799399ce34204a6d3970f20d7e529, which do not have
any significance in it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/577111/

Change-Id: I2e12d45acce6c759b3b7e787a322bda568ff74e4
Closes-Bug: #1468992

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-26 13:25:07.000000000', 'message': "Use rally 0.12.1 release for stable/pike branch.

Rally does not have any alignment of own tags to OpenStack releases.
In theory it should be possible to launch the latest Rally against
old clouds.

To follow the common processes and policy, Rally synchronized own
dependencies (python-*client's and oslo.* libs) with g-r. It made a
conflict between installed versions by stable/pike@devstack and rally
itself.
With Rally master branch it became an error (Rally's team is
working on moving in-tree OpenStack plugins to the separate repository
openstack/rally-openstack).
Rally 0.12.1 is the latest release which doesn't contain a breaking
change.

Ideally, to avoid such issues in future, Rally devstack plugin and
zuul job should install Rally in a virtual environment, but such
change requires more time for investigation and implementation.

So this patch is a quick workaround to avoid version conflict
of python dependencies.

Change-Id: I73ef5c978e66a89bb70be28468e0d1f40a71d94f
Closes-Bug: #1778714
(cherry picked from commit a4233220d8e897bba262ce8e5700994213583ccb)

commit_message:
Use rally 0.12.1 release for stable/queens branch.

Rally does not have any alignment of own tags to OpenStack releases.
In theory it should be possible to launch the latest Rally against
old clouds.

To follow the common processes and policy, Rally synchronized own
dependencies (python-*client's and oslo.* libs) with g-r. It made a
conflict between installed versions by stable/queens@devstack and
rally itself.
With Rally master branch it became an error (Rally's team is
working on moving in-tree OpenStack plugins to the separate repository
openstack/rally-openstack).
Rally 0.12.1 is the latest release which doesn't contain a breaking
change.

Ideally, to avoid such issues in future, Rally devstack plugin and
zuul job should install Rally in a virtual environment, but such
change requires more time for investigation and implementation.

So this patch is a quick workaround to avoid version conflict
of python dependencies.

Change-Id: I73ef5c978e66a89bb70be28468e0d1f40a71d94f
Closes-Bug: #1778714
(cherry picked from commit a4233220d8e897bba262ce8e5700994213583ccb)

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated classic drivers for Cisco UCS hardware

This change removes pxe_ucs, agent_ucs, pxe_iscsi_cimc and
pxe_agent_cimc. Best effort clean up was done to the documentation.

Change-Id: I4fe75e0d4a36228f2f6be6bf6ced6d37424b6fd3

commit_message:
Add 'openstack-db' tag to db-sync Exec resource

In order to make easy orchestration on all OpenStack db-sync, add this
tag so people can use this tag in composition layer.
A use case it to set some orchestration to make sure MySQL Galera is
ready before running any Exec with this tag.

Change-Id: I79c078e5945c45090cdb53959f3e87d2d7e18081
Closes-Bug: #1755102
(cherry picked from commit bdbf6614e1fe5f78e58786498956815e48890a27)

commit_message:
Add a role for the standalone deployment

This is not an undercloud or overcloud deployment.
This is a new single node composable deployment for TripleO

The review adds the role to handle the logic. It also
updates the reproducer script to handle the new toci_jobtype
definition so the job can be recreated properly.

Change-Id: I8f2c3daed748ea7a6d6a17e9db420a5ec1779d7f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-25 19:51:12.000000000', 'message': "[placement] Demonstrate bug in consumer generation handling

When PUTting allocations to a non-existent consumer, the code
expects the consumer generation to be 'null'. When there is only
one resource provider in the set of allocations sent, this works
well.

Unfortunately when there is more than one resource provider the
loop which calls _new_allocations still uses the 'null' generation
but now the code expects the generation to be 0, because the
consumer now exists.

This patch provides a gabbi test that demonstrates the problem
by creating a shared disk resource provider and associating it
as an aggregate with the existing RP_UUID. A GET
/allocation_candidates is made and a single allocation_request is
returned including both resource providers. A test with a new
consumer is marked as an xfail.

In the next patch the problem will be fixed.

Change-Id: I1238f82dfc46fd9dae126abfd16ce3dd1506e991
Related-Bug: #1778576
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] Demonstrate bug in consumer generation handling

When PUTting allocations to a non-existent consumer, the code
expects the consumer generation to be 'null'. When there is only
one resource provider in the set of allocations sent, this works
well.

Unfortunately when there is more than one resource provider the
loop which calls _new_allocations still uses the 'null' generation
but now the code expects the generation to be 0, because the
consumer now exists.

This patch provides a gabbi test that demonstrates the problem
by creating a shared disk resource provider and associating it
as an aggregate with the existing RP_UUID. A GET
/allocation_candidates is made and a single allocation_request is
returned including both resource providers. A test with a new
consumer is marked as an xfail.

In the next patch the problem will be fixed.

Change-Id: I1238f82dfc46fd9dae126abfd16ce3dd1506e991
Related-Bug: #1778576

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: I0dd012777df5ab535a4a76fc566e91ffec5ac94b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix volume type creation, switch to targetcli for CentOS

The Cinder client will likely disappear at some point and it seems
to be having issues with setting volume type.  This patch replaces
it's usage using the OpenStack client instead.

CentOS does not use that package but instead relies on targetcli
to take care of any target related work.

Depends-On: I2e42ef4022aaaa2e1cb9f461e63ce2e9e1f49511
Depends-On: I3df2c670beeb78baaa1515bcd27e8f2b0d95b3a9
Change-Id: Ife5023bc4752cf3c2d7221f9f8772990c6bc09df

[{'created': '2018-06-21 09:23:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add cpu_mode in nova.conf

With libvirt 2.0, when using qemu cpu mode is not properly
evaluated and need to be set to cpu_mode = none.

Add this option when kvm is not supported, otherwise user
will still facing errors when launching instances over qemu.

Change-Id: Ib00fa257fb33fd3281f484a47a945640da8dda56
'}]
commit_message:
Add cpu_mode in nova.conf

With libvirt 2.0, when using qemu cpu mode is not properly
evaluated and need to be set to cpu_mode = none.

Add this option when kvm is not supported, otherwise user
will still facing errors when launching instances over qemu.

Change-Id: Ib00fa257fb33fd3281f484a47a945640da8dda56

Gate: Add glance radosgw/swift backed gate

This PS adds a gate using glance with swift backed by radosgw as the
backend.

Change-Id: Id6d732b56877b0acfbe884bfdca322e8ebe9fef6

commit_message:
Move k8s keystone webhook check to voting after manifest changes

This changes the keystone webhook check back to voting once the
helm-toolkit manifest changes are merged in, and depends on the
openstack-helm patchset that introduces the changes the manifest
change required for this check to pass

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/576001

Change-Id: I337fe6d57a978e5b92d5bb5ae844e16bb8082609
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <wilkers.steve@gmail.com>

commit_message:
turn off undercloud idempotency check on fs002

Turns off undercloud idempotency check on fs002
Turns on undercloud idempotency check in fs20 or
periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp-featureset020-master

Related-Bug: #1777939
Related-Bug: #1777941
Change-Id: Ib83aed5fa55a9deb6ac8a90817ad05d2f281dcb6

to use the project-template instead.

subject: Make APT pinning noop on distros that don't use APT
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-22 17:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-22 17:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-22 18:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-22 18:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Mohammed Naser with the following votes:

* Code-Review+2 by Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-25 11:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hmm why is this necessary? The role is not meant to be used by non-APT distros anyway.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-26 11:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-26 12:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Because of the fact that we are using the project template, the jobs fails under centos.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-06-26 12:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Can you explain the issue a little bit more? so the problem is that you want to use the project template thing and that also pulls in jobs from other distros?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-06-26 16:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Correct.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577469/3

If we want to use the project template everywhere, all jobs will run, so we need to somehow make it pass for those unsupported OS.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-06-27 03:19:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Support python-requires metadata

Expose the python_require setuptools option via the python-requires
metadata item in setup.cfg.

Closes-Bug: 1735668

Change-Id: Idf2bb90882121e118f5b7531e027d350c0e4a441
Co-authored-by: Dennis Verspuij <dennisverspuij@users.noreply.github.com>

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Change-Id: If60f98fc069c040680f58658aacc63a156c4317f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Sphinx 1.7.5 has some breaking changes that treat a couple specific
warnings as errors. Keystone isn't failing on them directly, but we
do rely on an interface from oauthlib/oauthlib that has compatibility
issues with that version of Sphinx.

This commit overrides those comments in keystone's implementation of
the interface so that we can get our documentation job passing. Once

commit_message:
Override oauthlib docstrings that fail with Sphinx 1.7.5

Sphinx 1.7.5 has some breaking changes that treat a couple specific
warnings as errors. Keystone isn't failing on them directly, but we
do rely on an interface from oauthlib/oauthlib that has compatibility
issues with that version of Sphinx.

This commit overrides those comments in keystone's implementation of
the interface so that we can get our documentation job passing. Once
the oauthlib docstrings are fixed upstream, we can consume a version
of oauthlib that addresses those incompatibilities and remove the
duplication introduced here. This has been reported upstream in the
following GitHub issue:

  https://github.com/oauthlib/oauthlib/issues/558

Change-Id: I197bc346ffb2ed75ba68aa2e9c2f82a0cad163e6
Partial-Bug: 1778603

commit_message:
Adding --availability-zone to vnf-create command

This patch adds --availability-zone to supports Availability Zone
option in VNF creation. This argument is used to specify which
Availability Zone that VNFs should be placed on as well as enable
high availability of VNF across multiple connected zones in
Openstack deployment.

Co-Authored-By: Cong Phuoc Hoang <hoangphuocbk2.07@gmail.com>

blueprint: availability-zone-support-in-vnf-creation

Depends-On: I3b73f0e327280e91826be6106389be20d6f68f7c

Change-Id: I569e7f2c146ec036c20e4676087cb9ab09901e33

'}]
commit_message:
Fixing extjs check on cdh and mapr

On images generated from sahara-image-elements cluster is being stuck
due to double execution of the unzip code.

This fix prevents the code to be executed twice and in the case it does we
force unzip to overwrite.

A release note was added to this stable/queens backport because the issue
affected the stable release 8.0.1.

Change-Id: I73836a516b839bdb368997af3693c139c1fff390
Story: #2002551
Task: #22113
(cherry picked from commit f5bf9ff2643a18cc91c2e62cfd086e869fd00b5d)

commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.5

This fixes several performance and module issues. One such issue we'll
need resolved can be seen here:
 * https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-extras/issues/1278

Without this fix the `rabbitmq_user` module will stacktrace if the user
password is change.

Change-Id: Ibab4b2e5478d73d01bd8465417f3a1aa7c7469dd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Connect to websocket proxy for exec

In before, zunclient directly connects to docker daemon
for doing interactive execute. This patch makes zunclient switches
to connect to the websocket proxy server.

Depends-On: I68e49b99eee9e6c22a9df2cc19a1d2ba5053489e
Change-Id: I68d2b3daaaf8fb551d00774f01ad0ee88538f7ae
Closes-Bug: #1735076

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Depends-On: I3df2c670beeb78baaa1515bcd27e8f2b0d95b3a9
Change-Id: If9670a75a05b50a8afe4986f01cebd57a963cf17
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Adjust roles_data during FFU

Make the changes required when a custom roles data is use to allow
fast forward process from Newton to Queens.

Change-Id: I408e2cd9ee566fa7137b3034bcee8a35553c10c6
